description:
I have been living up the block from this Philz for a while now and didn't even know it existed! Shows my power of observation. But I walked in one faithful Saturday to be met with joy and professionalism from the alchemist barista, Rob. He is a man of myth and splendor that made me the most tasteful and tantalizing iced coffee of my life; the Mint Mojito. Because of this rewarding experience, which absolutely brightened my day, I will be back for further Mint Mojitos and other delicious hot/cold beverages. Thank you Rob - my Barista of the Month. 

Quick Note: try their croissants  they are also delicious and light, flakey. Pair well with any coffee.
author: Chris O.

description:
Arrived in the city extremely early and decided to find a Philz Coffee because it was recommended by a dear friend.  Decided to Yelp the closest location to my hotel and it brought me here.  Wish I read the reviews before I ventured off.  My directions from my hotel lead me through streets full of homeless people.  I will not lie, I was afraid.

Happy I got to my destination without incident.  It was early morning so the iced mint mojito was not what I was ordering, but what was recommended by my friend.  Asked my barista for a recommendation because it was my first time here.  She recommended Tesora and I like it.  I also got the Mediterranean Avocado & Egg Toast, yummers.  

Shop had a few patrons when I arrived but shortly after 7am there was a line that included several police officers.  

Lots of seating and outlets, a major plus.  

Need to return to try that mint mojito, but maybe I'll try a different location.
author: Bessie B.

description:
What in the world is wrong with the people who work in this store? And while we're on the topic, with the patrons who are packing this place?  For goodness' sake, baristas, you're working a service job in a coffee shop. In the Tenderloin, no less.  I've known concertmeisters with less attitude.

For my sins, I suppose, I waited in line in this godforsaken pile of hipster entitlement just long enough to ponder its many lessons in how not to run a business. You'd think something as simple as dispensing a hot cuppa joe made pourover style, possibly adding a snack, and getting me out the door less stressed than when I arrived would have been mastered by Philz by now. And you'd certainly think they'd have figured out how to get it to you hotter than a baby bottle.

It was a very simple transaction that I asked of them today, but not so routine that not one, but both baristas could resist using their three minutes of customer interaction to see how much one-upsmanship and snark they could inflict upon their luckless patrons enroute to mixing them a tepid cup of gritty brew with a side of stale carbs . 

It's quasi-Turkish coffee, a beverage that has lubricated conversation and cross-cultural understanding as the ultimate symbol of convivial hospitality for millennia:  just one of a million ironies that are lost on these insufferable, sub-competent fools.

Cater-corner to a law school and the federal building, I contemplated what I'd rather see in its place as I waited a ridiculous 12 minutes for my 16 ounces of overpriced disappointment. It arrived sporting an unspanked sprig of mint that went about as well with the coriander and coffee flavors as a squirt of Worcestershire.  I was momentarily distracted by having to use two hands and a foot to pull a section off the world's toughest and stalest cinnamon roll that seemed to have been made of wood putty and spackle mixed with enough sugar to make my fillings ache, but soon the vision swam into view:

A Dunkin Donuts.  Yep, that would be great. Law students late to class would know with 100% certainty that their freshly ground, freshly brewed drip would be ready on time.  Pastry would be tender and unselfconsciously bad for you.  Service persons would have to wear little pink uniforms that would drain the smirk out of them so fast that they wouldn't get have to get fired for talking to customers the way these "servers" do all day long without a twinge of conscience.  Blue collar folk like the security guards from the Federal building, unhip matrons getting their passports before the trip of a lifetime, and bewildered tourists would be treated with dignity.  Tenderloin predators would get the bum's rush.  It would cost $2 for a big cuppa joe, and lord a mercy, IT WOULD BE HOT.

A girl can dream.
author: Shoshi D.

description: Why is philz the best coffee in the world ???? If only I knew! It's been a while since I've had a mint mojito and after so long it was nice to get a taste of that perfect refreshing cup of coffee. My fiancé ordered a Mocha Tesora which he devoured in seconds. It's a cute location, very spacious, and clean.
author: Neloffer E.

description:
My company decided to get everyone coffee earlier this week. Our delivery order was scheduled to arrive on Monday, April 30th between 9:30am and 10am. It arrived via Caviar around 9:45am.

Jacob's Wonderbar: Dark chocolate, smoke, and nuts ($3.50)
*Hot
*Large (+$1)
*No cream or milk
*No sweetener

I used to drink coffee all the time, but I've been more into tea in the recent years. I wasn't sure what to order, so I decided to go for a dark roast as that's what I used to love. The description of this one sounded the best, so I just went for it. I'm definitely a coffee purist, so I just got it black. The coffee was very strong. Especially for someone that doesn't drink coffee as much anymore. (I do make a few cups of drip coffee every morning, but it's not very strong.) I appreciated the intensity, but it was a little too much for me. It did give me a nice caffeine rush as I felt slightly spazzy afterwards.

I never really got on the Philz coffee wave as I stopped drinking coffee as much after they got popular. They do serve a quality cup though.
author: Elena N.

description: This is my fav Philz! The staff are amazing, their mint mojito made with love!!! The place made you feel your home. Eventhough its around tenderloin, it feels safe and clean!!!
author: Jholor S.

description: You probably know the deal. There's a million of these places now, which is awesome. But what I learned recently is you can order ahead on the app! This is especially helpful if you're getting coffee on the way to the office. I was able to put in my order on the bus and be in and out of philz in less than a minute. Pretty sweet.
author: Misha T.

description: Nice coffee shop near the civic center and city hall. Great place to pick up your morning coffee or study/work. Large space with a lot of tables and a few couches. Service was great, a barista immediately offered to give suggestions if I needed it (I did) and gave a great recommendation. I got the Iced mocha tesora-good rich flavor, strong. With a little cream, good Iced coffee!! Also got free baklava for being a first timer, and the barista even brought out a second piece for my boyfriend! Overall great experience, very reasonable price.
author: Amanda C.

description: Do Not and I repeat Do Not walk here!!!!!!!!!! The walk is extremely scary and the streets are full of homeless people, Uber here and taste amazing coffee.
author: Mane S.

description: Nice coffee spot in not the most nicest part of town. A friend recommended the mint mojito coffee. I was skeptical at first. That sounds like a 5 PM drink I thought. Mint don't belong in coffee! I was still thinking that but halfway through my large drink, it grew on me!
author: Julie N.

description: Mint Mojito Coffee has always been my favorite drink at Philz. Clean coffee shop with plenty of seating and fast friendly service. Hubby and I did walked from our hotel Parc 55, so do be aware that you'll be encountering a lot of homeless  on your way to Philz if you're planning on walking.
author: Kristen K.

description:
Ya give me any other coffee brand (except Starbucks), this place being local I thought I would give them a try: BIG HUGE MISTAKE. 
I went into the place and stood out as a tourist. There is no guidance to show where to order coffee and where to order muffins or bagels or whatnot. So I guessed and I guessed wrong. The employee rudely stated go over there to place order and here to pick up coffee. When in San Francisco, do as the locals do? 
The egg burrito I had was down right disgusting. I should have tossed in the trash but it was the only breakfast I got and needed it for energy. I went with an iced coffee with hazelnut as well and have had better coffee at McCafe which is bottom of the barrel in my book. Oh well to each his/her own. Enjoy or not your choice.
author: Scott H.

description: I need a jolt and like to people watch in the unpredictable part of San Francisco . On one corner I see a career Politician on the side of the street I see someone passed out on the sidewalk by the Wells Fargo ATM. Stepped in Philz and took a sip of the ice mocha and I felt the zen. Not even a needle on the sidewalk disrupted my mood. Philz is the answer once my cup is filled.
author: Juan V.

description: The staff are all really nice people and the service is quick considering how many people are ordering. The selection of food is good for a coffee shop offering gluten free bread was a bonus. The medium blend Philtered Soul is strong. I asked for avocado and egg on toast, they forgot the egg part haha but the standard avocado on toast was still delicious.
author: Sarna B.

description:
Damn, I'm Phil'in the hype here.

Mint iced mojito was on point--got it less sweet and creamy which is how I like it. Sweet notes from their syrup gave my rich bitter coffee what it needed, and the fresh mint made the iced coffee a pleasant experience for my tastebuds.

My mom and dad got a mocha and gingersnap--both also delicious but extremely sweet. Would recommend getting it less sweet unless you're into the sugary thing!
author: Alyssa W.

description: This was some great tasting coffee, the mint mojito is the perfect mix of coffee, mint and cream! And the pastry was great!
author: Kenia G.

description:
On 6/1/2017, glorious Thursday morning, I visited here in San Francisco, CA to explore this another well known Bay Area franchise coffee shop located near SF City Hall at Civic Center called, "Philz Coffee." Philz Coffee serves the customers to enjoy and slip their finest cafe drinks and treats every 365 days a year; from morning to evening! The atmosphere and the concept remain the same as most Philz Coffee has across California, and for this Golden Gate Avenue location, it's much old fashion modern filled with wooden backgrounds and indie decors across the whole interior room.

The baristas here are doing a great job for making the customers like me a sensational service despite the moderate environment. No cons at all!

Now onto the drinks! I did ordered the Philharmonic with a fresh mint on top. As I drank it, that drink was perfectly amazing and tremendously good; closely better just like their Embarcadero location. Also, their fresh vegan made coconut donut tasted flawless! Very eatable and moist; not too harden and dry! Not a bad way to start the morning right!

Parking at the Philz Coffee at Golden Gate Avenue can be challenging to park. You can park at their nearby surface street parking if it's available. You can also ride a bike, walk, ride sharing or public transportation easier without the hassles and gimmicks.

In the end, Philz Coffee at Golden Gate Avenue is the most remarkable local coffee shop from the Bay Area that I've ever visited. A well received visit indeed! My rating: 4 solid stars.
author: William L.

description:
I love my go-to mint mojito from Philz. I always get it sweet and creamy. 

This location is good for hanging out. There's lots of seating.
author: Sophia L.

description:
This Philz is very busy, as it serves everyone working near Civic Center. It's fairly spacious with a variety of seating options, which is great for meeting up or just getting some work done. I've heard that were issues with rowdy homeless people coming in and now they have a security guard posted at the entrance, but I've never had an issue and I feel like this is unnecessary (I seem to recall a former barista writing an open letter online regarding similar issues at one of their South Bay stores). Parking is exactly what you'd expect for such a busy part of the city, but much better on Sundays when it's free all day and no one is around.

My recommendations:
- My favorite blends to drink black are probably Philtered Soul and Hazelnut.
- Sometimes I like doing half Philtered Soul and half Yerba Mate, which gives the coffee a more herbal flavor. Not everyone's cup of tea (haha get it), but it's an interesting alternative if you wanna try something different.
- If you want something on the sweet side, go for a White Christmas - 1/2 Greater Alarm + 1/2 Hazelnut with cinnamon and nutmeg in the filter, sweet and creamy.
- On a hot day, look no further than the Iced Coffee, extra sweet, extra creamy. Terrible for the arteries, wonderful for the soul :) The Mint Mojito and iced Mocha Tesora are also great options!
- The food here is good, but pricey. If I wanna treat myself, I'll get the avocado toast with egg.
author: Joe M.

description: I'm not sure what it is but I was not a fan of this place at all. I ordered a simple chai latte and it tasted nothing like a chai latte. I didn't even take more than 3 sips because it was so gross and after those 3 sips it went straight to the trash which was a shame because it was not a cheap cup. I will give 5 stars to the staff for being really kind and work quickly when there is a long line and 5 starts for the area due its several seating area. This location is not in the best location, civic center area, but this place can get busy so come here early as you can. This place gets busy at lunch at as well. For those of you whole enjoy this place, great, but I will be sticking to my Starbucks from now on.
author: Anne R.

description:
It's hard for me not to give five stars to Philz. The coffee is just so good!  

Compared to other Philz stores, though, this one has some unique challenges:

First of all, the bathroom here just seems to be consistently dirtier than other Philz locations.  Take this morning for instance:  I'm not sure if this is simply the way that the bathroom gets cleaned but there was about 1/2 inch of water all over the floor.  The staff knew about it because they had put up one of those yellow A-frame signs that said "Wet Floor."  Now it didn't smell bad (like the wet floor was the result of an accident).  But all the same, it was weird and a little disturbing. Perhaps they are simply cleaning the bathroom more often due to the volume of foot traffic at this location?  

Second, some of the furniture just seems a little dirtier than at other Philz.  Again, perhaps it is just a busier Philz than most, so there's just more wear and tear. It's not a barrier to coming here, but it's just not as nice compared to other Philz around the Bay Area.

All of the above is not to suggest that this is a bad place.  The wifi is pretty fast.  The music is good.  The staff is super-friendly and there is plenty of seating.

If we could award 1/2 stars, then this would get a 4 1/2  Since we can't give 1/2 stars, however, I need to give this place 4 stars since it's not quite at the same level as other Philz stores.
author: Paul O.

description:
I'm not a huge coffee drinker and when I do drink coffee, it is of the vietnamese iced coffee variety that is extremely strong, dark, and at times, overly sweet with the condensed milk mixed in. 

So when you ask me to rate coffee, it is almost akin to having a blind man judge a swimsuit contest. But because I was in SF and needed a cup of java, I make my way through the tenderloin to this urban coffee oasis and pick up a small cup of the Hazelnut and chocolate flavored "Philtered Soul". It is an enjoyable and warm bodied cup of coffee that was perfect for the cold winter morning. I was expecting the taste of nutella in it but that wasn't the case. The nutty flavors were very subtle, and I didn't notice the chocolate. It was an enjoyable cup of coffee nonetheless, but it didn't kick me in the face as much as the vietnamese coffee I've been used to drinking most of my life, which has only one real flavor. 

I can totally see the appeal, and the coffee is quite good. There are a variety of flavors to choose from, and i'm sure someone who is a coffee aficionado would be able to go to town here and try everything on the menu. But for your average joe...no pun intended, this place is a solid stop for coffee.
author: Alvin S.

description: Always a go to. Love Philz!!!  They never disappoint with service and quality. The coffee is great and potent. So worth the price plus love the
author: Scot M.

description:
Conveniently located across from the main passport office in San Francisco is another great Philz coffee shop. 

Great staff, good iced mojito coffee and the best avocado toast I have yet tried. The coffee shop is well kept, clean and comfortable especially when you have a wait ahead of you. 

It was a great experience as always like most Philz coffee shops.
author: Mehrnaz H.

description:
worst experience in this coffee shop.
I love philz coffeee, all the time..I go to drink my favorite mint coffee. However, a barista just keep forgetting my order..waiting for the 35 min.
I do not understand what it's going on this shop.
waisting my time..
I definitely will not come back this coffee shop..

I will not come back..
author: Hyunjun Y.

description: It's a nice place to chill and relax. Coffee is great as usual but the bathroom is pretty dirty!
author: Rafael A.

description: One of the best mint teas I've ever tried! I'm not sure about coffee as we didn't order one, but it seemed like people really enjoyed as well. It is all freshly made right in front of you. A little bit crowded place though, but I guess it depends on the time you are coming here.
author: Sasha F.

description: Amazing coffee! We discovered Philz when we were in SF for a few days and definitely feel the loss now that we're back in Texas :(
author: Melody T.

description:
Philz is the best coffee place in bay area. I have tried almost all the types of coffee and I my personal favorite is "Mint Mojito" iced coffee with extra cream. I know people will be reluctant to try the Mint Mojita but trust me they make it smooth and not too strong. It is perfectly blended in this imperfect world and it just made right. 

The service here is excellent. All the barista's are sweet and polite. They have good knowledge to answer all your questions according to your taste and also if you have trouble ordering. Apart from coffee I tried the cheese bagel with Cucumber and Tomato and they were delicious. 

The location of this place is convenient and is in downtown SF very close to the civic center bart station. They have amazing natural lighting and have a lot of space inside and outside for people to relax, study, watch netflix and enjoy their exquisite coffee drink. 

This place has a chill vibe and being in downtown makes it more lively. The only drawback is  that it is hard to find a parking spot nearby. There is street parking available but it is paid.  

They have free and open Wifi with good speed. 

Checklist:
Parking - HARD to find
Wifi - Free
Price - Towards the expensive side
Quality - Great
Quantity - Good for the price
Recommended - YES
Wait time - 5-20 mins
author: Nishant M.

description: Im not gonna lie, when my brother told me about Philz mojitos I was skeptical.. I mean I love mint but I wouldn't prefer it in my coffee. BOY was I surprised! Philz has made me a changed woman! The mojito was the BOMB.COM. Seriously, branch out to Seattle please! It was blended perfectly. So smooth and so refreshing with just the right amount of sweetness! Not to mention the shop was super cute with ample seating and spots to charge up any devices. Highly recommend.
author: Somaria C.

description: This is an excellent choice for specialty coffees. I've had the Tosora and the Mint Mojito and baklava (random choice, but it looked great) and they've all been delicious. I also appreciate the patience of the staff as I stared at the foreign menu. Added bonus; they have sugar and milk options, which is great because I'm lactose intolerant so I could get almond milk. I definitely recommend this spot!
author: Erica H.

description:
I'm actually not a huge Philz fan, but this location is pretty good.

I would ding them for the slow, chaotic service (more-so than other locations).  Also, for some reason it always smells awful when I've gone in.
author: Jason F.

description:
Blah blah blah.  For the Nth time and the Nth review, Philz is my local fave.  

I do have to say though that this location is probably my numero uno.  The store is huge, clean, ventilated well, and you don't leave smelling like coffee.  

Some of my faves?  Philtered Soul, Mint Mojito, Tesora, and Ethiopian...all light and light.  

5 solid stars.
author: Jen W.

description: I love this place. Their iced mint mojito is something worth of trying. Customer service is definitely on point as well!
author: Alina B.

description:
One cup of coffee at a time that you can never go wrong with. Philz soo good to my soul! :)

This review is long overdue. I've only had the Philtered Soul, xtra creamy & sweet with mint leaves and its so BOMB you will not be disappointed. I find myself smiling in a daze while drinking this. One day I will decide to try a different drink but until that day comes Philtered Soul it is. The Danish display case taste just as good as it look. Get the cinnamon roll!! See you at Philz !
author: J'Wel V.

description: Amazing Coffee! The jam toast with cream cheese was just delicious! I wanted more! Definitely worth the walk!
author: Angelyne H.

description: Coffee is aight. Typical hype type coffee. HORRIBLE bagels. Never get food here. THE BAGELS ARE ALWAYS BURNT. The people at the counter are too busy dicking around doing nothing.
author: Jessy N.

description: After seeing that Philz is about a 0.4 mile walk from my hotel. I decided to grab some Philz before hitting the road. This location is nice and spacious. The girl who took my order was very nice and I always get the Ice Mint Mojito. If you never had it, definitely give it a try. You can have it sweet or not sweet. Can't wait for Philz to open their location in Sacramento!
author: Shannen C.

description:
Move aside Starbucks and Peet's - there is only one coffee shop that truly has my heart. Philz Coffee. Ahhh. What a refreshing, delightful cup of coffee. It awakens your palette and lifts your mood instantly. I cannot get enough of their cool, creamy, Mint Mojito Iced Coffee. I've tried (unsuccessfully) to replicate it at home and other coffee shops. But nothing can replace the original. 

The cool mint and creamy sweetness compliment the wonderful, rich coffee and served over ice - this is the best summer (or year-round) drink out there. The service is always friendly - and although maybe not as fast as your typical coffee grind spot - each cup is crafted by hand with love. And trust me, you can taste the difference. So when you want something more than the ordinary, come to Philz Coffee and I promise, it won't disappoint.
author: Courtney P.

description: Oh my !! Best coffee I ever had,,  I walk in , just to see what was this place all about , and so I look a the board menu , and I choose Ethiopian light blend honestly one of the best coffee I ever drink I normally don't post but when I do , I do it right I love this coffee shop , among the others I pay 3.50 for a small coffee but oh well it's well worth it !!!
author: Mayrah C.

description:
Great selection of coffee and I like that they divide the menu by the strength of the roast.

I got the Turkish blend and at first I wasn't too sure about the mint garnish but by the end of the cup I was a big fan!

I've also tried the Arabic option that was full flavored but not too acidic. 

Love the options here!
author: Ray K.

description: So ive stopped going to this coffee shop and have started taking my business to blue bottle. They sneakily surcharge for credit cards without posting a sign they are surcharging. To me its shady, food places make very high margins already. Ill miss jacobs wonderbar.
author: Rehan S.

description:
HANDS DOWN THE BEST COFFEE I'VE EVER HAD!  We need Philz Coffee in the east coast!!!

I walked in around 9:00 AM on a Thursday morning with my friend and the place was packed!  I was a bit confused with the ordering process but quickly figured it out.  You actually order the drinks first at the counter then pay at the register after.  The employee will call your drink once it's ready!

My friend and I both got the Mint Mojito Iced Coffee ($4.50 for a small, $5.00 for a large) and it was DELICIOUS.  The foam was sweet and minty.  The coffee was perfect in every single way.  There are a bunch of seatings in this location so make yourself comfy!

I will definitely be back when I'm in the west coast again :)
author: Racheal D.

description:
Where do you go when you need to be on call in or around the courthouse?
Well, this was my spot on a recent Friday morning.
My friend told me to go here instead of that green logo java place down the street and, yes, it worked for me.  
When you enter this spacious store the order counter is to the left, cashier in the center, and the restrooms to the right.  There is a mix of high top counter and stools, regular tables and chairs, and even some lounge chairs for chillin'.  Not a coffee drinker, I ordered a hot chocolate (https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=sykCI9zAmplzgoayjfw9og&userid=saJuyv784apZzH--psHZ3Q), paid for it at the cashier, and waited for my order to be prepared.  After getting my hot drink from the barista, I found a high top stool near the restroom, strategic you know.  After settling in, I checked on my emails and texts while waiting for a possible call from my attorney. As time passed, I noticed that there was a security guard in a blue jacket standing by the restroom, thinking 'that's interesting'.  Given the neighborhood being the edge of the Tenderloin and Civic Center area, I shouldn't have been surprised.  Getting restless and wanting to stretch my legs, I decided to leave, but, of course, not before making a trip to the loo, just in case.  I glanced at the guard to make sure I was okay in using the unisex restroom and all was good.  
Despite of this, I felt safe here as the customers seemed to be a mix of Hastings Law students (campus just a block or two away) and idle working government staff (Federal and State Buildings within a block).  
Though I won't make a special trip here, it was certainly nice to find a warm and safe haven for a few hours.
author: Mike C.

description:
Philz Coffee where have you been all my life! Oh that's right, on the WEST coast. So I'm not a huge coffee drinker but I do enjoy a nice latte from Starbucks on occasion. It's not that I don't like coffee, caffeine is just funny with my body most times. However, I was up early for a morning bike ride and one of my friends recommended Philz as a must do in San Francisco so I decided it was one of those morning that I could tolerate caffeine. And boy, my taste buds were happy and the caffeine kick was great for my bike ride (no upset stomach or headache here). The space was great, I wasn't sure where to stand while ordering or where to wait but that's because I'm a newbie. However there was plenty of seating in the big open space. Also I noticed a security guard guy standing near the bathroom, not sure what that was all about but I didn't question it further. So based on my friend's recommendation I ordered the Iced Mint Mojito. I took a chance because I'm actually not a fan of mojitos or mint in general. Weird because I guess I am now because I loved the Iced Mint Mojito! The barista asked about the sweetness and I was super confused but mentioned I don't like things too sweet so he said he'll make it less sweet and could add more sweetness if I wanted. It was perfect. Super refreshing and even though there was a good amount of fresh muddled mint in the cup it wasn't overpowering. I also got the Mediterranean avocado toast with sliced hard boiled egg. Good bread and the herb oil "Mediterranean" was a nice twist. 

I am also SO EXCITED that Phliz has come to my hometown of Washington, DC. I literally just discovered this after my trip to SF and my new love for Phliz!
author: Debi N.

description: Best coffee i've ever had, the staff is so friendly and helpful. Best experience i've had for a coffee, i'll come back every day here during my stay in SF, thanks Philz' team :)
author: Billy B.

description: First time trying Philz. Tried the Jacobs at Katlyns advice (she was really helpful) It was spot on. Thanks Katlyn!! Super friendly staff and tasty treats / coffee. Nice space to get a cup of coffee and sit for a bit. Will be back
author: Nik G.

description:
Mint mojitos are my favorite!
Whenever I'm in the area and need some java to boost my day, I make sure I stop by here to pick one  up.

There's usually a line here before 9am and it takes a while before you are called because the baristas are busy making other people's drinks.

I have never studied here before but there's plenty of tables. It does get a little warm in there so if you don't like stuffy and warm places, it might not be the best place for you to study or stay for a long period of time. Definitely good for those cold SF days though! 

They also offer baked goods, bagels and other drinks including bottled kombucha.
author: Kelly L.

description:
First visit to Philz Coffee. It is quite the experience. Coffee brewed one cup at a time. The baristas are very nice and ask you many questions to make your coffee the way you like it. I ordered the large mocha tesora. And I am glad I did on a wet rainy day in SFO. The mocha is rich, creamy, hot and smooth, just the way I like it. 

I also ordered a large hot black tea. The mint and honey fused well to create a just like home experience. The warm cup and soothing taste offered a much needed welcome for my first day in SFO.

The atmosphere is alive. Lots of conversation with all sorts of people talking, sharing tables, collaborating, working on their laptops. It is quite the seen and a very popular location. You will be lucky to find an open seat, but when you do enjoy all the excellent people watching.
author: Vince T.

description: Everytime I am in town, I always have to get out of my way to get some Philz coffee. How can anyone say no to the yummy Mint Mojito? I totally recommend this place to all coffee drinkers because Starbucks is aight....
author: David Dat T.

description: This coffee was incredible! I am visiting from out of town and this coffee is out of this world! They had an incredible menu with unique flavors and iced coffees. The vibe was really fun as well! This place is highly recommended!
author: Gary M.

description:
As coffee goes Philz know how to do a good brew. Found myself here yesterday while wandering around the city and was really impressed both with the service and the coffee.

This is not just a run of the mill coffee chain these guys take things seriously! There must have been 50-60 options for a cup of the dark stuff ranging from mild and fruity varieties right through to the rich and dark end of the spectrum......obviously I went reich and dark being a hardcore coffee fan with a friend taking a mocha. Both coffees were exactly as advertised and tasted fantastic...served with a smile and about $3-$4 each.....can't complain.

Loving your work Philz! I'll be back.
author: Daniel G.

description: Philz Coffee is hella good. Many varieties of coffees, I had a very strong one, among the strongest ever had. Well brewed. Nice cakes too, big tables to work, near little Saigon.
author: Owen G.

description:
Our second time at Philz, this time at a nice location near the Orpheum theater.  We just finished a pho lunch and it was warming up in the late afternoon in SF - so of course we had to get the mint mojito!

The medium Mint Mojito ($4) - a blend of regular soy milk ( you can get vanilla soy too), iced coffee, and fresh sprigs of mint -lots and lots of mint!  To say the drink is refreshing is an understatement - it got smoother and sweeter over time until the last gulp!  

This particular location is pretty big and has plenty of seats and tables.  Wifi a bit spotty though.
author: Daniel C.

description:
It's official. I have now had my own full coffee and it was from this wonderful place. I opted for a mocha (one step at a time) but it was wonderful. Not too sweet but not too coffee-e either. The perfect combo of strong and sweet in fact.

I really cool location, just round the corner from city hall, great for a pit stop when on a San Fran wonder. 

Really shabby chic inside with large couches and plenty of seating. Loved the vibe, and loved the staff - who were very friendly and knowledgable about their coffee. NEXT, the mint mojito cooler - YUM. 

I'll be back!
author: Bethany W.

description:
Very convenient location. Close to all the government buildings. I always get the Ecstatic(?), sweet & creamy. You can customize the way you want your coffee, and the baristas always encourage you to try your coffee to make sure that it is just right.

The coffee is super delicious, but it also is a little pricy.
author: Do P.

description: This place has become a staple in my afternoon routine when I need to get my energy up. I love the Jacob's Wonderbar and the Tantalizing Turkish. Everyone raves about the Iced Mint Mojito so I finally had to try one and it was awesome! This is coming from someone who loves their coffee really hot and never like iced coffee until this delicious beverage.  The best coffee I think I've ever had. Baristas seem to juggle a bunch of different orders at once and still greet you with a smile when they take your order.
author: Deidre H.

description:
The only coffee I like is from Philz (spoiled, I know haha). My go to order is normally the iced mint mojito, but if I feel like getting something more coffee-like, i'll go for a silken splendor or an iced ecstatic! Sweet and creamy cause it's the besttt!

This is the only location i've been to since it's down the block from my work. It's pretty cozy with all the couches, but the ordering process was a bit confusing for me during my first visit. You order first, pay second, and lastly go back to the barista to get your drink. 

One thing I wish I knew before I spent a small fortune here... You can bring your own travel mug and only get charged for a small cup! $4.50 for a large travel mug fill up? Ohhhh yes, so worth it! The first time I did it, I could barely finish my cup..... lol!
author: Tara A.

description: Got coffee on my way home, Elisa was incredibly helpful, and made my night. The coffee was great and when they were out of cookies she gave me a pretzel they were going to throw out, and made a disappointing moment into learning how good there pretzels were.
author: Daniel H.

description:
Came by the other day after having lunch in the skechy Tenderloin district. As there are lots of questionable people hanging out in the street, they have a security guard outside who also acts as a doorman...

The coffee shop itself has plenty of seating and is perfect for studying or meeting up with friends/colleagues!

 Staff is friendly and there is a numeric passcode to use the restroom...just ask at the counter!

Tip: Get the Kouign Amann from Starter Bakery! :)
author: Derek S.

description:
Everyone who lives in SF knows what Philz Coffee tastes like, so I will focus on the storefront instead.

Convenient location on the corner of Larkin & Golden Gate.
The interior is verrryyy awkwardly set up. Whoever did the interior designing for this location needs to be fired and brought back to school for Designing 101.

It's a HUGE space, but is very poorly used. The result is a lot of open space that is not used.

You walk in and there's a huge line leading to the baristas. But so much open space to the left & right.
The barista counter does a weird "V" angle, so there is a lot of unused open space behind the counter to their back room/storage area.

The limited amount of chairs, tables, and couches seem scattered in a disarray and definitely could be moved into a more streamlined way to maximize space, while adding more seating area.

The colors are drab, and makes the store feel very crowded and tiny.

The bathroom is the worse. It is basically a reminder that you're still in the TL. I saw needles in there one time and a pair of dirty, disposed pants. So gross.

Yeah, this place basically needs Robert Irvine or the folks over at the Home & Garden Network and fix this place up.

But the free wi-fi, good coffee, vegan cookies & donuts, and close location to my home means I'll have to continue to face this eyesore of a store.
author: Lanie L.

description: My favorite coffee place. I heard they'll ship coffee to you and will be a subscriber when I move to Omaha next year.
author: Ralph R.

description:
Before anyone hates on me for rating Philz only 3 stars... this was my 2nd time trying their Mint Mojito Iced Coffee.  First one was from Santa Monica and I absolutely hated it...but since I was in SF, I thought I'd give Philz another try in hopes it would change my mind given the fact that Philz originated in SF.

Welll..............it only changed my mind a teensy bit. :|

To summarize quickly, my first experience was terrible.  Every sip I took, I'd end up with leaves in my mouth.  I took off the lid to see what was going on..only to find an entire bush of mint leaves in my cup.  I literally had to fish it all out before drinking my coffee--which I didn't finish.

THIS TIME... I made sure to let the barista know I wanted my coffee to only have a little bit of mint...she looked a bit confused at first so I said "less minty" and then she knew what I meant.  She also asked if I wanted my coffee to be "sweet and creamy because that's what most people get" so I said sure. I didn't know you could choose the level of sweetness because my barista didn't ask me... I only found out later when my friend told me :|  

When I finally got my coffee, I snapped a couple pictures first because it looked so good and photogenic.  I took a sip...expecting fireworks but it was just okay.  It's basically just minty iced coffee... and it wasn't as sweet as I had expected it to be.  By all it means, it was better than my first cup from Santa Monica but it still isn't something I'd go out of my way for.  Not mention, $4 for a small is pretty pricey IMO. 

 I just can't pin point as to why people rave about Philz so much :(  No more for me.. I'll stick with Starbucks :T
author: Regina O.

description: Walked by while heading to the Asian Art Museum. I am used to the original location on Van Ness so walking by this one is a big difference. This place is bigger and has a nicer feel to it. Theres plenty of nice wooden tablets and seats to sit. The place is very open. I ordered an ice mocha tesora which was darn delicious. Still one of my favorite coffee chains in SF.
author: Sarah C.

description:
Calling all coffee lovers in the area!

If you have yet to try Philz Coffee, then you are missing out on a whole lot of goodies! Not only is the coffee delicious, but the workers here have a "can-do" attitude which wakes me up even before my coffee! 

I wanna say that everything on the menu is great! Personally I enjoy the Mint Mojito and Ginger Snap Ice Coffee, because I can enjoy it in the morning before work or school and in the afternoon after a busy and long day. 

So, If you have yet to try it out then what are you waiting for?! Even if it is just a sip, you NEED to try it!
author: Benson M.

description: Besides Jesus this amazing place was my lifeline this weekend as I served with middle schoolers at City Impact... Thank Thank Thank you for th amazing service and coffee!
author: Tara K.

description: Ok, so I'm from Seattle and I know a good cup of coffee when I drink one. I read the reviews before coming in and thought, 'is it really that good?'... Yes it is. Plus the barista was so lovely and welcoming, it really made my morning. I hope one opens in Seattle one day, ha.
author: Romeo G.

description:
This has been my Philz for the last few months, and it is outstanding. I won't bore you about what you already know; yes the mint mojito, gingersnap, philharmonic, and dancing water are pretty much God's gift to us caffeine-fiending mortals, but if you're reading this, you already knew that. However, bonus points if you know about the Alfajores. Unless you or your folks are from South America, if you have tried them, you are a true experimentalist.

The ode to this Philz is about the people. Each person I have had help me, and I have in the past 4 months been here multiple times a week, has never made me feel like some annoying customer because I ask 20 questions every time I come in. Most of them strike up a conversation. And all of them treat you with the courtesy and respect we no longer necessarily expect to see in large chains. Major props.

*just note that this isn't necessarily just about the Civic Center Philz, I've never had a bad Philz experience at any location. I just consider this my local Philz.
author: Carolina G.

description:
A more convenient location compared to the ones on Van Ness, 18th St or Mission Bay, just not as helpful. Philz is turning out soon to be McDonald's and just opening locations after locations with less service. 

Always has police either sitting inside or outside with their friends.
author: M C.

description:
Quick, efficient, friendly, clean, and delicious coffees. This was the only coffee shop that turned a coffee-hater to a coffee-lover.  Just the right amount of flavor and sweetness.  I wish there was a philz in the outer sunset because I would go all the time!

Favorites: mint mojito and jacob's Wunderbar
author: Jennifer L.

description: Love Philz coffee. Always packed but I always manage to find a table. Ambrosia coffee of god with milk and sugar is good...strong and aromatic.
author: Rexy T.

description:
Hello Philz.

Want to know how our Sunday morning routine looks like? wake up, snooze for 30 mins and finally get out of bed to grab our cups of love at Philz. 

This has become our go-to location as of late, not the prettiest neighborhood, but it has plenty of street parking, spacious seating areas, flaky butter croissants from Starter Bakery and strong wifi. 

He makes fast decisions when it comes to getting caffeinated. A Tantalizing Turkish 99% of the time.  I stand there and I peruse the whole menu, my choices usually gear towards the Mint Mojito on warm days, but rainy days call for something hot. A chai tea with almond milk (too watered down last time) or a decaf Ethiopian, a bold blend with a silky smooth aftertaste. I don't need caffeine because I'm already bubbly even without it. 

Thanks for being part of our Sunday. See you soon!
author: Janice C.

description: I love philz and their coffee. But if your yelp profile says you tske Apple Pay and then you don't, it's annoying. I got there from the gym with only my phone and apartment keys and had to leave without coffee. Sucks hard!
author: Tobias G.

description: This is just a few blocks from the Turk location, but I like it a lot better. It feels a lot cozier while the space is actually larger. Same great menu, a few of my favorites are the Tesora, Mint Mojito, and Gingersnap. There are about 7-8 tables of varying sizes and a few couches where you can hang out. If you're driving, especially in the morning, reading the signs carefully. Golden gate, the street that Philz is on, has street cleaning on Tuesday and Thursday and from 6-8am!
author: Gloria N.

description:
I am always like it here just because of their taste if coffee... Organic, strong, rich, and smelled ( I cannot not drink too strong coffee tho, bit of milk and sugar add on would be wonderful, but their smell of coffee is lovely) !!!! Their mocha teraso is such a thing, a thing when you drank one, you definitely will come back for the second, and the third :)

I am not adv. for Phiz tho, it's true that their coffee is better than Starbuck in my opinions :)

There are many Phiz's location the one I love the most is near by the Sunnyvale cal train station!!! Their staff were very graceful and their drink also unforgettably gooooood!!!! The second location is the one I am sitting in ryt now---- the Phiz's golden gate !!!! They also nice!!! And ALWAYS there is a line when I come :((( but their always value their customers as I can tell :)

Anyways  try Phiz's out, and you will know the real coffee that I am enjoying:)
author: Chiem E.

description: First coffee shop I went to on an all-day layover in San Francisco. Ordered the Philtered Soul. Solid choice. Would characterize the service there as knowledgeable, friendly, overall great. Visited same location again later that day. Also, being a first-timer, I was given a complimentary baklava. Would recommend.
author: Varun C.

description:
Very nice team! Coming from Europe I cannot swallow the typical US office coffee.  Filter coffee has way too much caffeine. 

I returned the undrinkable brew and they gave me a refund without any fuss. Definitely try it.  Maybe you like it.  I for my part stick to a decent espresso competently pulled by an experienced barista. Although the way they make coffee is impressive.
author: Flo B.

description:
5 stars just for carrying Starter Bakery goods.  So far I've had the caramel chocolate cake and the lemon bundt cake.  The bundt cake is moist and lemony just really good!  Caramel cake is yummy as well.

If you byoc, you will only be charged for a cup of small coffee.  Great place to go if you're not in a rush.  If you are, you should check out Peet's instead.
author: Wendy H.

description:
This location of Philz has been more a pre-game or post-game spot whenever I visit Brenda's French Soul Food.  It's nice to be able to enjoy a cup of Philtered Soul while waiting for your table to open up at Brenda's.

I do agree with some other yelpers that the set up here is very awkward and can get really confusing during peak times, especially for newbies that aren't familiar with their 'order at barista, pay second at cashier, pickup from your barista' system.  That being said, when it's not busy, it's almost like a very cozy lounge because the space is pretty huge.

It's a very nice location and a great spot to take your out of town friends for their first Philz Coffee experience if they don't have time to venture down to the original 24th St location.
author: Rodney H.

description:
Philz on golden gate
TO THE MANAGER AT GOLDEN GATE :

I am a 66 year old disabled retired educator with 35 years of teaching experience both here state side as well as in Italy, where, from 1991-1998,  I was hired to serve as the on-site Academic Director & Assoc. Professor of Italian Studies for an American College Semester Abroad Program in Siena, Italy.  As an evaluator of students' academic performances, it was also incumbant upon me to observe. -& monitor when necessary -their moral &  ethical compasses along with their manners & appropriate levels of maturity
when interacting not only in the classroom.but also in any other professional setting. With such a vast amount of experience in this filed, I can now tell you how impressed I am with Sean Tate, an employee at your lovely place on Golden Gate. Yesterday morning, I had to re-charge my Fiat 500 E , & the closest place was at the nearby Civic Center Garage, a facility I had never used before. When I arrived at the  station on Level 2, it was noon. I took out my back pack & computer, and since no one was around the parking lot, I posit the items on the ground in front of my Fiat & then went to the pump-only a few feet from the front-to get it discharged, & as I turned around to plug it in my 'e-tank,' to my horror I saw a very unsavory young man clutching my items in one hand while wielding a knife towards me in his other one. Paralized with fear,  I heard the thug say, " Don't yell or move an inch," after which he  then fled away. Shaken to the core, I went to the guard's station to report the ugly incident. Luckily, I had my wallet on me. As I walked out of the dark garage, I meandered out into the light of day,  dazed & numb with incredulity of the unexpected the terror I had just experienced. I asked a passer by if he knew of a good coffee shop & he pointed me to your place. As I made my way to get served, Sean greeted me & asked what I'd like. I then told him of what I had just gone through, & I must let you know how genuinely concerned & kind he was. He went out if his way to ask me if there was anything he might be able to do to help me in any way possible. I was so impressed with this young man immediately upon hearing him say that to me. It is indeed a rarity to find this kind of gentlemanly compassion which he also impressively demonstrated with much finesse & class. I will always remember this young man, & now Philz on Golden Gate will be one of my favorite new destinations in the Philz Galazy to enjoy a cup of your delectable coffee & goodies because of my most positive experience I had with with your employee, Sean Tate.
author: Franco N.

description: one of the best coffee shop in the bay area.
author: Jonatan A.

description: Chai tea had very little tea flavor, and was over-spiced. Zucchini bread with chocolate chips was good, though.
author: Steven K.

description:
Voted Best Coffee In SF!!!  

Strong and bold...Philz has the right stuff.  Looking for a quick boost of energy?  Philz Coffee has you covered.  I usually prefer my coffee simple...black with no sweetener or an Americano with no sweetener. Philz has my type of coffee and a lot more.  Iced Mint Mojitos, Lattes, Tesora, and Sooo Good are just a few of their blends that I noticed on their menu.  I got their Philtered Soul, which is their medium dark roast that is supposed to be sweet & nutty.  It's definitely nutty.  For all you hazelnut fans, this is for you.  I loved it.  This cup of Joe came with an instant buzz without the crash or caffeine high.  

PS: This Philz is spacious, clean, and the staff was great.  Too bad Philz isn't in Las Vegas.  Too bad for me.
author: Mel C.

description:
This place is always nice and warm... it gives off a good homie vibe if you come early enough before the rush hits. The workers here are great too. My favorite barista here is probably Nate. Always hooking it up and always chopping it up when he gots time.

I've tried majority of their drinks and food here, but I usually take the mocha even though their mint mojito is their best. Ohh try their avocado toast with egg. Hella bomb dude!
author: Kaname S.

description: So cool how they have this spot set up! Drinks on one side and food on the other, super quick service and so many options. I just ordered their hot chocolate and it melted my mouth! Definitely recommend.
author: Cayla H.

description:
I absolutely adore this Philz Coffee location. I have seen it been built and didn't have a reason to stop by. But a couple days I was working at the PUC which is down the block, I had to grab a cup of coffee or two ...

This location is new and has many seats and couches. I like how it is spacious. The baristas here are as wonderful as the original Philz Coffee in the Mission area. Since it was in the morning, I didn't want to get the usual (Mint Mojito). I couldn't decide what hot drink I wanted.  The barista recommend me the Tesora. I don't like Caramel so I chose philtered soul instead. He was super patient waiting for me to decide what I want and he was friendly! 

In my opinion, I feel like this location doesn't make their coffee as strong as the Mission location & the Van Ness location, which I'm grateful for. I love Philz Coffee, but my coffee tolerance isn't as high, but this particular location is my now go-to-spot for  Philz Coffee!
author: Kathleen U.

description:
All about that Half-Caff...

Philtered Soul mixed with some Swiss Water and light on the almond milk.  My GO-TO.

Balanced.  Refreshing.  Exactly what I need in the morning to keep it tight and right.
author: Hiromi N.

description:
This location has less wait than the Van Ness location! Come here, if you want to save time.

I like the:
-Iced Mint Mojito! Get it now. Again. And again.
-Free Wifi
-Not so long wait time
-Plenty of seats
-Cute baristas, who makes delicious coffee

Meh: 
-I wish the tables and seats were placed differently
-Outlets can be hard to reach at some tables

Only big problem I have with this place is that I can't get enough haha.

Recommended? Yes, definitely!

Protip: Bring your own mug and save money for larger size drinks
author: Solongo B.

description:
Why did I wait so long to write this review?

Philz is definitely the top spot for coffee in SF, hands down.  They have several roasts to choose from and they'll make your cup individually.  There isn't much of a wait for it either.

The best part is they have perfect temperature control every time!  There's nothing worse than a scalded tongue because the coffee was too hot.  You can drink your coffee from Philz as soon as the barista presents it.

I prefer the darker roasts, but the medium ones are tasty as well.

Oh, and Phil couldn't be a nicer guy to (literally) run into...  I mean I almost spilled my (his?) coffee on him when I bumped into him.  He played it off and even stopped for a selfie...well done!
author: Josh M.

description:
My friend ordered me the Mint Mojito Iced Coffee... and I thought... uhhhh this might not work.
IT. WAS. AMAZING!
I have been to Philz a handful of times, and it is always a treat!
author: Jennifer W.

description:
This is Philz, therefore it is excellent, however this is an exceptionally good location for a few reasons:

- Plenty of seating
- Lots of outlets
- Fast and free (open) wi fi

And despite the tenderloin proximity, there is little to zero riff raff that passes through the double doors. 

Consistently great coffee, per usual.
author: Nick K.

description:
As a long time barista (and coffee drinker), I cannot find the appeal here. Sure, it's cool to have so much variety of coffee but it's desperately acidic. I tried several varieties (there was a group of us) and each had a dryness that can't be covered. Also, the flow is extremely awkward; order coffee here, food here, pay here - it's a stunted flow. Finally, the staff seem so engrossed in what they're doing (focus is great!) that they seemed bothered to be friendly. 
I will say that the food selection and music are great. Having avocado toast and a wider bagel variety was very nice but I definitely wouldn't bother to come back.
author: Kaylie L.

description: A Yelper mentioned the drink Greater Alarm and I immediately thought about something totally irrelevant.  I referred to Greater Alarm as an epic alarm clock of whales moaning under the moonlight and as awesome as that sounds, the drink itself was pretty darn good.  About 45 minutes in and halfway through my drink, still no jitters.  I was told that firefighters usually get this drink before their morning shift so I was expecting something really strong.  Regardless, this drink is good.
author: Linda N.

description:
I don't understand the hype of philz coffee at all.

I'm a huge coffee lover (addict). I drink coffee 1-3 times a day. Don't judge me... :P

The boyfriend and I paid $9 for 2 "large" iced coffees. First, why the hell do they serve iced coffee in hot cups? Second, their large size is more like a medium. When I say I want a large, I want a large (maybe it's just the addict talking in me). Third, they serve you your cup of coffee with no lid on top. How many times have people spilled all over their floors and counters? They have lids available for you to put on yourself but come on.. I'm paying almost $5 for a drink; they could at least put a lid on. This is madness.

I thought the taste would make up for all these weird things but nope. I got anesthesia to the upside (a medium roast) over ice. They ask you if you want cream and sugar and then sweeten it for you. That would be fine if they made it taste good but they didn't. It barely had any sugar. The coffee didn't even have a good flavor. It said it was supposed to have blueberry accents to it but I didn't taste anything.

That was the first time I haven't finished my coffee. I drank a little less than half and threw the rest out.
The bf didn't finish his either. I felt dumb afterwards for suggesting to try it. What a waste of money.

I only gave 2 stars because the staff was really friendly.

Verdict: one and done.
author: Clarissa H.

description:
Another reminder of why the Bay Area puts DC to shame when it comes to food and drink. The coffee here is pretty amazing and tasty. The service is also friendly and efficient. Really don't have to say more than that do I? 

That being said, the prices warrant a "once a week" policy for me.
author: Sean B.

description: We were at the Orpheum a couple blocks away and needed a caffeine pick me up. So we walked over and got in line. It was the middle of the afternoon and everyone had a similar idea. This place is pretty big with some tables and couches and counters with high chairs. Good place to just chill. We ordered with the barista, paid with the cashier. So weird that they have the honor system here, as they do with all the other Philz I've been to. As in you pay for what you told them ordered and it may or may not match up with what you actually ordered. I got the small hot mocha tesora. I don't know all the customizations. I just let them make it the regular way.  Very delicious - it's very chocolatey. Individually brewed and $4 for a small cup though. It's my favorite drink here. Well the only other drink I've tried is the mint mojito and I didn't like it as much.
author: Alison W.

description:
Philz Coffee is well known for their iced mint mojito, and it seems that they are made inconsistently between different Philz branches and between different baristas. My friend and I came here yesterday-- she ordered a small mint mojito and I ordered a large one. Hers had too much muddled bits and pieces of mint while mine had too much  whole mint leaves bunched up at the bottom, that basically took up half the cup. I was a little disappointed with my drink since I barely got any coffee (I probably had more mint leaves than liquid).  Granted we had different baristas prepare our drinks-- I would have thought that there would be more conformity in the way drinks were made.

Since I don't go to a particular Philz when I want my mint mojito iced coffee fix, I can't recommend a particular branch or barista to make the best coffee drink... But one thing I would recommend is to ask for less ice and not too much mint (be it muddled bits or whole mint leaves and stems).  If you tell your drink maker this, you'll probably won't go wrong! Overall, an average experience -- 3 stars!
author: Matthew L.

description:
There is definitely a love-hate relationship going on between me and Philz Coffee.

From the time I stumbled into their flagship location in Folsom and 24th back in August 2010 to my religiously daily visits to their Civic Center (Van Ness) location (including holidays) from Fall 2010 to the initial opening to this Golden Gate location and thereafter, I made sure every out of town coffee drinking visiting guest made their way here.  (Canada, Hawaii, New York, L.A. before their opening in Santa Monica, Hong Kong, Philippines)  

That included my wife when she moved to the Bay Area.  Throughout our entire courtship and visits to her and her family, I came to visit them with Philz Coffee in tow, explaining to them that an in-person visit is a non-negotiable.  When we got married and she moved to the Bay Area, I made sure Philz was one of her first stops. (Actually, IT WAS her first stop)  Around the same time, attrition of the awesome staff began and instead of replacing themselves with someone just as awesome as those who departed, it seems that they were just filling in bodies behind the counter.  

Then the prices went up.  

Then I learn to ween away from coffee after being an everyday drinker for over five years.  Granted, customer service in corporate attempted to find a solution including gift cards and an open dialogue via email. 

But the damage was already done. I learned to do without coffee and I was able to return to being a "once a week" or "every other week" coffee drinker just as I was prior to discovering Philz.  

Being nostalgic, I returned there.  (I'm sorry the definition of "insanity" according to Mark Twain is what?)  I inquired if there existed a water filtration system for the water.  The puzzled staff brushed me off.  

Here's the thing.  If you're in a business where your main product is 95+% water, there should be some care into the quality of the water, shouldn't it?  And I'm not just singling out Philz.  Almost every corner in the SF Bay Area has a spot where coffee and tea are their main products.  I'm using this Philz location as a soapbox for this concern because of how much loyalty was paid to this specific location, and the prices.  If you could raise prices to offset costs in providing better benefits for your staff when the quality of your staff was in decline, then it wouldn't hurt to invest into improving the quality of your water.  It's not rocket science.  

Five stars for what it once was, and (negative) one star for it's current state.  Averages to three stars.
author: Terrence P.

description:
On vacation -  missus wanted java. Came in on a Monday. This place had it all. Great sketchy (as well as non-sketchy) people watching, very good strong coffee, free wifi, nice big seating area, long lines.

Got the bagel with a schmear (nice sized) and regular coffee
Missus got a large latte.

Missus raved about her cup - mine was good also (but I am not a coffee snob). 

We would do this again if we could.
author: Keenan K.

description:
I love Philz; their coffee is top notch.  And I've been to this store plenty of times in the past.  It's been a few months, though, and I was unexpectedly disappointed at my experience last week.

I walked in mid-morning on a weekday.  There was no line for customers, with about 4 people waiting for their drinks by the register.  So I was surprised that I had to wait over 10 minutes to place my order.  (I checked since I had a BART train to catch.)  I counted six employees standing around (not on break) behind the counter with only one actively making coffee (and another preparing bagels).  

By the time I placed my order, a long line had formed back to the door, yet none of the other employees thought they should step forward to help out.  My coffee took another 10 minutes, and the barista had to be reminded of my order.  Not a huge deal, I know, but it just adds to the frustration of waiting nearly 20 minutes and already feeling like the customer isn't a priority.

The whole place felt a bit disorganized and lazy - quite the opposite of what I'm used to with Philz down in Santa Monica.  I hope I just caught them on a bad day.  It's my first negative experience at any Philz in a long time, so I still give them the benefit of the doubt.
author: Andy C.

description:
DRINKS:
I love sweet coffee drinks so I highly recommend the Mocha Tesora if you also like lattes or mochas. This is a nice spot for people to chat or even to study since they have a lot of tables at this location. I also really like the mint mojito, but not as much as the mocha tesora. 

SERVICE:
The drinks take a little while to make so be a little patient.

WOULD I RECOMMEND IT? Yes
author: Kelley Y.

description:
Philz coffee, you have my heart! Their mint mojito is to die for, the perfect balance of creamy coffee with mint. It is my favorite coffee and I wish I lived in SF so I could have it everyday. I love watching them brew it so you know its made to order and they cater to how much cream and sugar you want! Customer service is definitely 5 stars!
I've also had their mocha tesora, jacobs and julie's dark roast. But seriously order the mint mojito!!
author: Vy T.

description:
When I passed this location the first time, I was happily surprised to find this Philz straddling the Civic Center and the Tenderloin. When it comes to Philz, the more the merrier.

So I dropped in the first chance I got. What's the first thing you notice here? Large space! But still crowded on a Sunday...with a mix of students, tourists and even some fellas from SFPD. Another case of, the more the merrier. 

It almost goes without saying the coffee is fabulous, just like all the other Philz. But I feel like I have to mention it, in case there's someone reading this review who doesn't already know. And Philz could use more fans. Yeah, you got it, the more the merrier.
author: Ted R.

description: I usually order a sweetened latte or the infamous mint mojito, but tried a mocha tesora based on a friend's recommendation. I'm so glad I did because it was so delicious. One of the best mochas I've had in awhile. I ordered it with soymilk and the flavor was rich without being too sweet. I got a couple of their vegan cookies and the peppermint chocolate was pretty good too. Service was quick and friendly. I'm still thinking about that mocha. Oh how I wish we had Philz in Sactown!
author: Mel L.

description:
I DO NOT like them controlling  the  amounts of cream and sugar.
Really Philz try out a cream and sugar bar .  
They DO NOT have reasonable prices but occupy a high rent spot . 
They DO have some fanatic customers who swear by Philz  
They DO have some good blends that is tasty coffee they also have some bitter choices . Philz food menu expanded . Good pastries 
They are much better than the crappy donut shop coffee across the street
The Coffee Mill on the other corner has a cup for a reasonable price and the taste varies but the caffeine fix is quite  powerful.and is a couple notches over the donut shop crap but it is bitter most of the time .
George and Lennie a block over has Ritual Coffee Company  espresso and a great drip coffee from Ritual no huge menu but it works. G&L prices compete with Philz.  Ritual roasts on the 1000 block of Howard giving the block a great smell.
author: Tim G.

description:
First of all...WHAT IS THIS PHILZ! After months of being separated from the Bay Area, the first thing I hear as I step into this location is Nelly Furtado - Promiscuous. I expect some damn hipster music to re-acclimate my bay area sensibilities. 

Seriously, You just can't ever go wrong with iced mint mojito! SHUT UP & TAKE MY MONEY! And open a Philz in LA! I think you'd do well in Westlake/WeHo area just sayin.
author: Steve C.

description:
Ok, so who doesn't like Philz?... Anyone?....anyone... Bueller?  Philz is a little bit of heavenly comfort that fits into the palm of your hand... or hands, depending on how cold a day it is.  This particular location turns out the cups left and right with friendly service to match.  Each "barista" makes your drink a little more special than the next and it's always lovely every time.

Don't skip out on the cream and sugar... yum yum.
author: Kevin J.

description:
I like the new the ample space of new Philz coffee shop in the heart of the tenderloin. It is also where the drug addicts hangout. 

I would also love to insert an iced cold $4.50 Mint Mojito coffee drink into the barrel of the syringe needle and inject the needle full of the iced beverage into my vein.
author: Matt G.

description: The people that work here are amazing!!!! One of the people that work here saw that I was having a really bad day and she walked my coffee over to my table I was sitting at. It was a small act of kindness that meant a lot to me on a bad day.
author: Heather W.

description:
There's only a small handful of Philz Coffee shops in the city. I don't see why the Civic Center/ Tenderloin/ Van Ness Ave area needs another one. There's already one on Van Ness and Eddy, just a mere three blocks away. However, what I particularly like about this Philz location is the design. It's more spacious. There's more waiting room for your drink. There's plenty of tables and a few couches. And most importantly, it's not as crowded. The only downside is that it's close to the Tenderloin, so walking here from downtown is a stink-fest.

The difference between the small and large mint mojito ice coffee is only 50 cents, so it's worth the upgrade. The drink has a plethora of yummy flavors and textures -- slightly sweet, minty from a generous handful of fresh mint leaves, and creaminess that isn't watered-down from too much ice. Once I get bored of the mint mojito, I'll try their other specialties... but honestly, does anyone get tired of this popular Philz drink?

Service is very friendly and welcoming, as always. Baristas take a while to make the drinks; however, the reason they take 10+ minutes for just one drink is because the quality is top-notch. They make it right in front of you, one cup at a time.
author: Priscilla W.

description:
I wont bore you with a whole "ermahgod mint mojito!" review.... Those are plentiful.

Instead, ill approach this review as a philz location in itself.

Having been to all of the philz locations, this one is a favorite. Sure, the fact it's a block from my office may keep me a tad biased (also see: broke) but the staff here is on their sh!t. when there's a line, they address the issue. When you order, a smile is planted on their faces. When you pay, they gracefully take your cash/card/soul. The turn around time is swift, they check in with you on the taste before you can step away and they ensure that caffeine is pumped through your veins leaving you to conquer the world (or sit in a cubicle and bang on a keyboard until 5, like myself). 

Consistency, in any business model, is key.... And this location nails it. I've known Jacob, Phil's son, for years and have even seen him and spoke with him here.... And he knows I'm a loyal fan/friend/foe. 

Whomever is in the training and development for Philz, I tip my hat for the work you've done with GG location; they should be on the pedestal of what a quality product and spectacular service looks like when  forces are combined. 

Tip: black bean burrito is orgasmic. Greater alarm feels like drinking adderral (YUM). 

Oh and.

ERMAHGOD MINT MOJITO.
author: Ryan L.

description:
Philz is my favorite coffee in the city. There I said it. Sure, Ritual is quite nice and Blue Bottle is dependable. But Philz is the shiz - which I think may be Yiddish for the shiz. How else do I explain my motivation for writing a fifth five-star review of Philz? A poor sense of recollection perhaps. What was I talking about again? Or maybe I'm just excited this one is actually walking distance from my home. Now that's something that gives this location an extra splooge of shiz. OK, I think I may be in need of a Tenderloin Berlitz street slang primer, but I've been waiting for this particular Philz to open for months. I would pass by on the way back from some pho in Little Saigon and fantasizing that a little Tesora could really hit the spot.

Fantasize no more. It's here, and it's spacious if you don't mind walking over laptoppers who appear epoxied to the sofas. That's OK since I usually order it to go anyway. My new favorite is Silken Splendor which contains the magical triumvirate of dark cocoa, nuts and butter. Paula Deen would drink this intravenously if she could, y'all. Did the price go up? It's $4 now for a large. Oh, who cares? I like how they ask you to taste it for sweetness even though the barista always brews it to my satisfaction. Besides, I sometimes buy a $3 vegan chocolate donut from Pepple's Donut Farm to get an extra kick of sweetness anyway (see photo). So glad you made it to Civic Center, Philz. You da shiz, fo' shizzle...I think.

COFFEE - 5 stars...best in the city...oh yeah? you and what army?
AMBIANCE - 4 stars...more spacious than the average Philz, a good thing
SERVICE - 4.5 stars...baristas here know how to brew
TOTAL - 5 stars...a Philz in the hand is worth two in the bush...whatever that means
author: Ed U.

description:
I love this new location! Well, semi-new. They've been open since March but people are still flocking to the Van Ness location. This one is calmer, has more seating than the other Philzs (Philzes? Philzeses?!) and a wide open waiting area once you've ordered and paid. At the other locations, you're forced to stand there awkwardly and be in the way of others when you're waiting for your cup to be called. 

Despite the extra seating, a table or even a spot for that matter, are hard to come by on the weekdays because of the abundance of students and law folks in the area. Free wifi makes the turnover even slower. 

I didn't particularly feel like committing to a New Manhattan that day, but I didn't want something as sweet as a Mocha Tesora either. The girl kindly offered to make me a mix of the two drinks by adding chocolate to the New Manhattan; she promised it would be good since that's how she drinks it. 

Staff and patrons alike are very friendly, and having two Muni stations practically equidistant makes this Philz a convenient stop on the way home. I just wish there was more than one restroom...but I'd take this location over the hustle and bustle at Van Ness any day.
author: Olivia V.

description:
Finally Philz Coffee Civic Center is open!  One block up from Asian Art Museum on corner of Larkin & Golden Gate Ave.  I went Easter Sunday 3/31/13 and got to try their Famous Mint Mojito Iced Coffee.  I ordered where the guy was making it, he asked if I want it sweet & they regular way they make it, sure.  Small is $4/ Large is $4.5.  I got the Small.

It took about 5 min or maybe less to make.  He smashed mint into the cup, made the coffee, & put a bit more mint on top, had ice in it too.  I liked it.  Looks good too.

They have Starters Bakery Chocolate Kouign Amann $3.5 & Regular $3.5; pre-made breakfast burritos $4.5, etc.  They have toaster ovens to heat your food up.  Saw Vegan donuts I think they are from Pepples Donuts $2 ea; Goodies Cookies locally made $3 cookie.

Several tables/chairs, & leather sofa seating.  Not a big room, looks nice though.

Charge it if you can.  Doesn't like REI Visa credit card on their iPad machine.  

One unisex bathroom - a huge Exit sign with key attached.  Lock when inside & when leaving.

NO Dogs Inside per Calif Law, I did see a guy bring 2 tiny dogs in there, nobody said anything!
author: Ann L.

description:
I said I was going to visit the new Philz when I am in the Civic Center area. Today, I came in here and ordered a beverage since I needed something for that caffeine fix. This is actually Philz Coffee #3 for me. The staff here are friendly and service is efficient! If you work in an office nearby or just passing by, Philz Coffee and Coffee Smith are here for you when you need that quick caffeine fix. I think I'm getting really addicted to that cup of Mint Mojito Iced Coffee!

Thank you Philz for the amazingly delicious cup of Jamaica Blue Mountain, Mint Mojito Iced Coffee and Hot Chocolate!

This shop is also very spacious which is a good thing since it gives customers more room to get in and out of the shop.
author: Bennett W.

description:
Philz Coffee had its grand opening earlier this afternoon and was giving away free cups of coffee, tea or chai.  

I am not a coffee drinker, but I don't look a "gift horse" in the mouth.  One of my co-workers mentioned they were finally open, suggested that I check them out and get a free beverage.  My first time in Philz and I didn't even know what I wanted.  One of the employees standing at the door offered a suggestion - yerba mate - which is a beverage from South America (Argentina).  The yerba mate with cream and two spoons of honey was absolutely delish.  It had me energized and I did not take that daily afternoon nap.

The lines were long and the wait was about 20 to 30 minutes for a free cup of beverage.  I was fortunate enough to have only 4 people in front of me.  Not only they serve hot beverages, but also cold beverages and yogurt.

This cafe is very spacious and has plenty of tables and chairs, free wi-fi.  The employees are very friendly and helpful. 

Finally, I missed out on the free samples of pastries, but it was all good.
author: Carol C.

description:
Philz is crack. Am I even allowed to write that? No, really, it is. 

Having a case of Monday mornings? Philz. 
Missed the bus? Philz
Clients giving you stress? Philz.
Exams stressing you out? Philz.
Forgot your homework? Philz.  
Good day? Philz.
Bad day? Double Philz.

Philz every day -- if I could afford it and I don't just mean financially. Let's face it, when done right, Philz is not exactly a Skinny Girl's go-to latte. It's an amazing time-bomb in you mouth full of sweetness and creaminess, with all the coffee nuttiness to bounce you back into taking on life full-force again. And the best part? They make it for you, with a smile. 

Extra sugar? No Problem. 
2 3/4 tsp of sugar? Already happening. 
Not enough basil? Here, let me toss it and brew you a whole new one. JK. Here's an extra leaf.

I love Philz. Pricier than your average? Yes. Insanely delicious and addictive? Yes. 

I'll take an iced Mint Mojito Coffee or hot Silken Splendor any day. 

This is a newer location. Spacious with lots of seating. Cozy and comfy.
author: Ellen W.

description:
Philz coffee is damn good!  You're not going to find a bunch of crazy options here. What Philz does have is about 20 different blends that they will grind on the spot and make a one off cup just for you. They use a pour over method to brew coffee one cup at a time. 

Next time you need a cup of Joe - give Philz a shot - you won't be disappointed!
author: Brandon D.

description: Wonderful place to sit down and enjoy a splendid cuppa joe.  Since we were going to the Orpheum and it's only a couple blocks away I wanted to BART over early and make our way to Philz for a delicious artisan sweet tooth coffee.  Not disappointed.  I have to say that they make the best damned mocha out there. Not to sweet, rich, creamy and chocolaty.  I've yet to have a bitter cup here.  The staff is always welcoming and smiling and the store is a great place to just hang out, enjoy your java and watch every flavor of humanity roll on by.
author: Edward H.

description:
Best coffee in San Francisco for me.  Beats out Sightglass and Fourbarrel - and I can get it at multiple locations.  I'm still a bit partial to the Van Ness location for some reason, but this one has tons of space to work or relax.  

Free Wifi and electric outlets should be enough to bring you in here.. Lately I've been doing the decaf thing to take a break and there's no difference in quality.  One of these days I'll try their scones....
author: Ben K.

description:
This was my first time at this location, but I'm sure it won't be my last. Located conveniently near Civic Center BART and attractions like the Asian Art Museum, the Main Library, and City Hall, this location is also very modern and spacious - perfect for the coffee shop study session.

I opted for the Mint Mojito Ice Coffee...cause the weather called for something refreshing. It did the job...but eh, probably should have ordered a more full bodied iced coffee instead.
