author: Elaine Y.

description: Tasty coffee with a variety of roasts; dark, medium, and light along with the best selection of decaf coffees I've ever seen. Personal favorite is Amborisa of the Gods. Only complaint is that when ordering coffee it could be hotter, but I also realize coffee shops might be leery of serving coffee too hot in case someone spills. As for the food offerings the selection is limited but a nice bonus is the selection if breakfast burritos which aren't bad. As for the staff they're friendly and efficient. The location itself isn't the greatest but  riff raff seem to stay away for the most part, perhaps because cops are always ordering coffee. Definitely roomie and more chill then the nearby Van Ness location.
author: Sabrina D.

description:
A wonderful little coffeehouse mecca in the Civic Center... 

I discovered this gem of a coffeehouse when I interviewed for my job last year. After drinking my first Jacob's Wonderbar (sweet & creamy, on the sweet side), I was immediately hooked. I've now become a regular for the last four months. The staff is wonderful -- they make an effort to get to know you, and all of them seem to  go out of their way to serve your coffee with a smile! Their pastries and bagels are excellent as well. I'm particularly fond of their jalepeno bagels (a new addition) and their bacon and egg breakfast sandwich.

Recommended brews:
Dark Roast: JACOB'S WONDERBAR (seriously, my all-time favorite dark roast!) 

Light: 
New Manhattan: this one seems to be a favorite with the staff!
Canopy of Heaven
Soo Good: Honestly, lives up to the name!

Medium:
It'z The Best: Pair this one with a decaf, I like Sumatra, for a little less buzz in the afternoon!
Philtered Soul
Tesora

Iced/Hot: 
Ginger Snap: forever now, my go-to, my absolute number one with a ginger-flavored bullet. This has overtaken the PSL as my spicy/sweet coffee drink of choice. PURE LOVE, PEOPLE.
author: Suzanne B.

description:
I rarely have more than my one cup of coffee at home in the morning (Graffeo dark roast), but on occasion I'll treat myself to an espresso in the afternoon.  Philz doesn't serve espresso, though. I understand that they'd want to distinguish themselves from all of the other coffee shops, but I wasn't crazy about having to get a whole cup of coffee (too much caffeine for the afternoon). I decided to get it anyway and not finish the cup, and ordered "Jacob's" dark roast.

All of the coffee is made to order, which isn't a bad thing, but what's up with not taking a name or giving you a number when there are dozens of others waiting for their coffee?  

The coffee was good, but nothing to rush back for. I also don't see the need for so many different blends; I suspect Phil (I assume there is or was a Phil, right?) would be fine with just light, dark, or mixed, and does this to cater to the clientele's need for their own special preferred choice.  

Not planning on rushing back, but will go there in a pinch (i.e., if I need a jolt and the only alternative is Starbucks). Too precious if you ask me.
author: Jim D.

description: I walked in and immediately was greeted. I asked if they had an iced coffee or a cold brew. The employee went into detail and different ways they were able to prepare it. Great service with a smile and my coffee was delicious. Light sweet with almond milk!
author: Cesar R.

description:
Love this Philz! I get the chai tea sweetened with honey. I'm sitting here right now enjoying the lovely music they play, their super fast internet, and great environment.

Great Philz!
author: Carina M.

description:
Cheap and good coffee is really hard to find. But one can definitely find something they'll love here. 

The coffee menu's different from the usual. From where I come from (Singapore), it's the typical Starbucks-menu that you see everywhere- lattes, flat whites and the works. 

At Philz, you'll find quite an extensive range of drinks. It's my first time here so I don't know much about how each of the flavors are uniquely different, but they sure look unique in their own ways to me. 

I came here seeing the high ratings on various sources and it didn't disappoint. The barista kindly made a few suggestions for me seeing how lost I was. Eventually I went for a large Silken Splendor. Dark cocoa, nuts and butter it ha, with a little bit of cream that the barista added for me. The coffee turned out to be a nice blend of coffee and cocoa, unlike any mocha or similar drinks I've tasted. I wasn't planning to go for something chocolatey but Silken Splendor and Philz' exceeded my expectations by price, coffee and service. 

Loved it and I'll definitely come back for more! Would love to see more of Philz!
author: Kenny L.

description:
Philz has a line to order (not clearly marked) and the cashier to the right(sign seen)

line moves quickly, lots of coffee choices
brew: aromatic arabic(lg 4) dark roast
-initially a tab harsh, tasted more smooth after a few sips

drips:
-fast, friendly, helpful service
-haven't found a dark roast i really like here yet.
3.5 stars.
author: Victor G.

description:
Five stars. Easiest Yelp rating I've ever given. 

I'm from SoCal and I've heard people from the SF area rave about how great Philz is. I have always wondered how good this place really is. Naturally, when I was in SF, I had to try Philz. 

It's on the corner of a questionable part of town. It's across the street from a law school, but it's also only a few buildings away from outreach clinics.

When I walked inside, I was surprised at how big the shop is. There are tables and couches spaciously placed around the room. You can sit and enjoy your drink without having the person next to you breathing down your neck. 

The coffee bar is pretty big also. They have so many different flavors of coffee! I was feeling like a dark roast, but there are several types to choose from and they all sound amazing. Since I was sure any of the selections would have been good, I asked the server for his opinion on the dark roast. He recommended Jacob's Wonderbar and I am so glad he did. It was one of the best coffees I have ever had. My heart broke when I realized my cup was empty. 

I would like to move to SF just so I could try out all the flavors at Philz.

Amazing.
author: Roxanne F.

description:
I came here on a weekday to get some work done. There's a lot of open space with tables, couches, and a work space area around a pillar. Not that many outlets, so I had to choose my seat strategically. 

I ordered a small iced mint mojito and a jalapeno bagel w/ cream cheese for a total of $7. My drink was actually a lot better than the first one I ever had. They toast the bagel and spread more than enough cream cheese on the bagel for you. 

They played music obnoxiously loud to the point where it was really distracting. I had to put in earbuds to muffle out the noise. I was able to get a lot of work done in the 2-3 hours I spent here because their wifi is really fast. Although I was productive, I don't think I'll be choosing this place to work next time.
author: Melanie H.

description:
I think I went here four times in one weekend and made many treks across the 'Loin to come here.

My favorites:
+ Mint Mojito Iced Coffee (with mint leaves and deliciously refreshing)
+ Jacob's Wonderbar (no milk if you love your coffee black! rich and chocolatey)

I did not like the Jamaican Blue Mountain for the price I paid for it but every other drink was an amazing experience. Philz is just different. Nice vibe, cool and friendly baristas, booo when the restrooms are closed though! 

Warning: This place is addicting and if you're as much as a coffee fanatic as I am, you'll be craving Philz from miles and miles and (sob) miles away.
author: Amy F.

description: Highly recommend this place. I had a Mocha Tesoro and my husband had an iced coffee mojito. Both excellent! Friendly staff, good environment.
author: Ellen J.

description:
LOVE! When I used to work in the area, I would come here at least once a week - I had to limit myself because I ain't a balla. 

But the service is always top-notch and they try to get people in and out. Much bigger location than their SOMA and Mission - have met people here for coffee. 

Their breakfast burritos are cool too.
author: Stephanie W.

description:
Honestly I think this is my FAVORITE Philz Coffee in the city! Although the area can get quite sketchy at night, once you walk in here you feel cozy, productive, and relaxed.

It can be a weekday or a weekend, I never had a problem with it being crowded. Now that's something!

PROS:
-PLENTY of seating. Outlets scattered throughout! Not too hard to find although I'd come with your stuff charged.
-GREAT coffee. I recommend all the iced tea.
-Super fast service & very friendly baristas!
-Accepts card.
-Never crowded where you can't find a seat.
-Fast and free wifi. (that in itself should get you to come!)

CONS:
-Very ghetto-looking bathroom. Also a passlock on it!
author: Ting Jung L.

description:
this location is much more spacious than other locations i've been to.  plenty of places to sit!  

i ordered the hot chai latte and it was pretty disappointing.  i would suggest sticking to what philz is good at, coffee, not tea.  my chai was served lukewarm, not very tea, not very milky, it was watery.
author: Alice C.

description:
I just don't see what's so special about watching your coffee drip then what ? The staff seems ok but this my 3rd time trying the coffee.
I picked up a cup to take to work with me thinking let me give it one last try.  
I'm sorry I don't get what's the big deal here 
The coffee is so so nothing to go out of your way for.
author: Veronica L.

description: Located in a prime area, this place gets quite busy. Many come here to study or do work on their laptops so the tables get taken fast. I was recommended to Philz to try the Mint Mojito Specialty Coffee. It's one of their signatures, a sweet and creamy iced coffee with mint leaves, but I just wasn't a fan of mint in my coffee (personal preference). I tried it and then opted for the Gingersnap specialty coffee which had a little hint of spice but I enjoyed it. It comes iced but I would actually request it hot next time. The staff was friendly and it was pretty quick, definitely worth trying!
author: Victoria E.

description:
If you're a native Bay Area guy or gal, you probably know everything about Philz Coffee already. If you're a new addition to the area like me, you learned it by now. And if you're here for the first time, then don't look any further - this is what it's about when people talk about the fantastic coffee of San Francisco.

Unique, custom-made blends, enriched with a special mixture of cream and/or sugar, customized to perfection by friendly baristas - this is Philz.

And if you're in town for only a few days, save all of that touristy stuff for laterz. Philz awaitz you.

PS: Great location - spacious with lots of seating, tablez, and couchez.
author: Sebastian F.

description:
First visit to this Philz location and  the Mint Mojitio Iced Coffee was as tasty as I know it to be! Gotta get it sweet & creamy. 
The space is much larger than what I'm used to (the Berry Street location in SoMa), so that's cool. I imagine it's geared towards the law school students, but I might be tempted to come hang out somoetime. Only thing is it's not the nicest few surrounding blocks if you're walking there.
author: MaryKate M.

description: Whenever I come here, the baristas are always super duper nice and friendly. I'm a basic bish and always go for the mint mojito, but I drink tesora at my office. Sooooo good!
author: E S.

description:
Got the mint mojo to iced coffee, and it's perfect!! It's not too sweet, and just the right amount of creaminess. The mint doesn't hit you in the face either. It's like a nice slap. Very fresh. And the customer service is great!

Excited to go to the one in Santa Monica when I get back to SoCal :)
author: Wednesday Y.

description:
as a frequent philz drinker, I usually know exactly what to order when I walk in!  I always go for the iced ecstatic coffee with medium sugar and medium cream. my go-to for my friend and I when we go.  I never went to this location before because it's not in my area, but it was morning and it was a block away from where I ate breakfast, so I saved the best for last.

I ordered two iced large ecstatic coffees medium-medium and was super disappointed.  my friend and I were in a rush so we sipped the coffee once and we gave each other a look. not the best but it should do... walked out and rushed to the car meter. took another few more sips..... omg this taste like watered-down coffee!!! what's up with this? as we took another few more sips, we soon to realize the barista probably forgot the cream... we took off the cap and the coffee lacked the creamy color and jus looked like watery coffee. this is the first time I experienced this at any philz.

the coffee was strong for sure but I don't think the barista knew how to make the medium cream and sugar part :/  i still ended up drinking the rest because i didn't want to waste it. but this location can def work on making it better and next time I'll take a few more sips before leaving the coffee shop.
author: Josie L.

description:
I love how friendly the staff is and how strong the coffee is! 

My favorite and go to drink here is the Ice mint mojito, but everything is great. 


I have great experiences at all their locations!
author: Helen L.

description:
i've been to couple philz coffee in the pass, but this was my first time coming to this one. My brother and i came here since the main library wasnt open yet

When we first walk in, we were lucky that there wasn't any line so we were able to order our drinks right away. I usually get the ice mint mojito coffee drink but i wanted a different kind of cold drink on a nice sunny day in sf from the last visit that i came. The person who in charge of making our order recommended Ice mocha. Thought it sounded good so decided to go with that drink. What i like about this drink is that it was Smooth and light. Since we were lucky that it wasn't busy, we were able to get our drinks within 5 minutes. 

Compare to other coffee places, you usually order and pay at the same area before you get your drinks. At philz, you order your drink first at one section and pay at another section...just gotta remember what drink you order when you go to the cashier.

This place is Clean, nice, spacious
author: Julie N.

description:
Great coffee, great pastry! 
The ambience was on point, staffs were friendly, and coffee was enjoyable. Would love to drop by here anytime (:
author: Sherry L.

description:
This review is more so for the location and the people that run the joint than anything else because let's keep it real, if you haven't been to Philz to sip their iced Mint Mojito... clearly you've never lived. 

Everytime I've had a chance to stop by here, I've had a really pleasant experience. I've always been asked how my coffee was before departing from the counter as they would make adjustments if it wasn't to my liking. THAT'S WHAT'S UP! 

WORD OF ADVICE: I've said it once before and I'll say it again and again. Get vanilla soy with it! Thanks again Fattycakes for intro'ing me to this. No #teammudbutt FTW.
author: Mike D.

description:
Mint Mojito Iced Coffee. Just do it. Don't hesitate. I'm not a huge "sweet and creamy" coffee fan but this drink is out of this world.  The baristas are always so nice and on their game. Long line?  No worries!  Each drink is hand made and you can truly taste the quality. 

So thankful I can walk here for my fresh minty treat!
author: Samantha S.

description: My friend and I went there last Sunday. A block away from Asian Art Museum. I thought it'll be crowded but I was wrong. Friendly baristas! We ordered chamomile tea and minty black tea.
author: Zen S.

description:
Feels a little weird for me to be writing a review about Philz since there's so many branches around. However, it was a surprise for me to see Philz around this corner. 

This location seems to be one of the larger ones they have around, with lots of tables and cosy corners to work on. The baristas are friendly, and they display small little fun facts about each barista right at the counter.

You can never go wrong with a mint mojito, even on a chilly day, so definitely give that a try if it is your first time! If you're conscious about your calories, go for lighter cream or low fat versions! :)
author: Christina N.

description: A good place for coffee lover but not many other options for people who don't drink coffee like me. The decorations are good (kinda dark), the internet is stable- a good place for work!
author: Lingxue H.

description:
Ginny & the gorgeous lady with red hair - you guys are awesome! Thanks for jumpstarting my day in a positive direction! 

This Philz Coffee spot has the BEST customer service, hands down! $3 for a small, $4 for a large, and they charge you for a small coffee if you bring in your own cup. In addition, I was told that Hastings students get a discount. It would be dope to give everyone who works within the 2 block radius (hint, SFPUC employees :)) a discount!
 
Got a free sample of some type of fig bar and an apricot bar. The apricot bar blew my dress pants way off. It was DELICIOUS! If you're a first timer, make sure you're not rushing to work when you get here because the line is always long in the morning (but worth the wait!). Also, try the Philtered Soul, Iced Mint Mojito,  or Tesora. You can't go wrong!
author: Kaye S.

description:
Wanted to see what all this hype was about when it came down to Philz Coffee.  

Atmosphere is very relaxed with a more modern/hipster vibe.  Chairs are comfy and it looked like a nice place to study in if you don't mind constant movement and noise.  I personally like being in busy spaces to study, so I wouldn't have too much of a problem.  There were a large number of outlets around the shop, so for those that have quick dying phones or need their laptops for survival you are in luck.

Mint Mojito Ice Coffee. Indicated on the Sign - Minty, Sweet, and Creamy-  I even had the barista asked me if I wanted my coffee to be sweet and creamy as well.  I said, "Yes," because I enjoy drinking coffee like a child with it being not coffee tasting and more like a pound of sugar added.  Nonetheless, I can still appreciate a good coffee being a former barista and I enjoy strong coffees as well.  This HYPED coffee tasted like a regular iced coffee to me with a slight minty flavor, but nothing significant.  Maybe it was the ice, but it tasted a lot more watered down that I would like and it just was not very good in my opinion.  

I say everyone should try it for themselves, but my review is that this place is HYPED.
author: Alisa S.

description:
Philz was a must needed stop Friday morning on the way to the Giants parade. It was dark gray cloudy with drizzles and freezing cold. So what better way to warm yourself than with a nice hot cup of coffee!

Perfect location on the corner of golden gate and larkin. Just a couple blocks from Civic Center.

We walked in surprised there was no line considering how many people were congested in this area for the parade. We were waiting for a barista to free up to take our order when one of them asked if we would like a free mint mojito. Who could say no?! It was what the bf was going to order anyways. What a great start of the day! One free large mint mojito creamy and sweet. I ordered a small Philtered Soul, my favorite coffee from Philz, but watch out, it packs a bunch of caffeine. I was on a coffee high all day!

Workers are amazing here! And they were all dressed up for Halloween! How Festive!!!!

Love Love Love Philz. Every store I've been to has been an amazing experience.
author: Stephanie L.

description: Super cool place, great coffee. First time going to Philz, the baristas were incredibly nice and helpful helping me get the best coffee possible. Will probably be stopping by a lot more and try out different blends.
author: Thomas M.

description:
Very disappointed.  Ordered one of the specialty blends.  The paper cup I received after a very long wait was filled to the brim.  I asked for a cup collar, but they had none. Just picking up the cup caused coffee to slosh over the brim, scalding my hand.

Did I mention overpriced?  I am as big a coffee snob as the next guy (or more so), but the coffee that was not used to parboil my fingers did not taste particularly special.  Hopes for a transcendent coffee experience:  rudely dashed.
author: David S.

description: This is the best coffee I have ever, ever had in my life. Love that it is local and love that Phil is around to serve coffee to his customers in the Mission.
author: Marge T.

description:
I'm not surprised this location is getting busier by the day. The baristas are really nice and the quality of food is good. I like my coffee semi sweet and they always get it right. 

In my last review I described about a cucumber incident. Well, now I have to have it in my Philz hummus bagel. Funny how tastes can change. The bagels are still yummy and at a great price. 

The price of the burritos has gone up. If you're already in the store and craving a burrito, then it's more convenient to buy it there. But there's another cafe nearby that has comparable burritos at a lower price.
author: Vira P.

description:
Always the Mint Mojito. Never disappointed.

The baristas are really good about customizing your drink exactly the way you want it!
author: Yanni L.

description: Quickest and most efficient Philz location I've been to so far. Service was quick, proficient, and courteous, despite being on a somewhat sketchy side of town (visiting from sac). The coffee is of course what keeps me coming back time and time again. My go to is the Ether blend: bold, robust, and  slightly smokey. Get it creamy and sweat. Or if it's hot outside, I'll do a Mint Chocolate mojito, chocolatey, minty, and coffee; you can't go wrong.
author: Kristin L.

description:
Quick & easy service for my mint mojito iced coffee! Great baristas :) 

Came here to grab a pick-me-up before heading down to my adopted home in SoCal! I miss ya, SF.
author: Kim T.

description:
I was passing by and saw this place and it turned out pretty cozy inside. My barista was awesome and full of character. I got an Iced Mojito Coffee and absolutely fell in love with an odd combination. 

Just recently found out there is one in downtown LA and I'll be definitely be heading their soon.
author: Aazar J.

description: Try the Mint Mojito Iced Coffee! Best ice coffee I've had. It has fresh mint leaves inside, which is edible of course. I simply feel happy after finishing it. Really wanted to buy one more but "one cup at a time".
author: Toby X.

description: This location rocks. This was the first Philz Coffee location I have been to. I can here to try the hot chocolate. It was good so good that I came back to Philz Coffee again. But I went to the Castro location on 18th street. I will also come back to this location when I am in the area and Craving so Philz Coffee hot chocolate. I noticed that there were a lot of people here at this location. That is good.
author: Isaac H.

description: I have to pee and was told by a security guard I have to order my drink before I can pee. Cool.  I'll get in line, hold my piss, order my drink and then pee.
author: Dan B.

description: I like this place as much as the next guy, however it takes forever for them to make your drink. It's a neat concept that they have one cup at a time coffee tea and hot chocolate. But you know what that means when there's a crowd! Long lines, a long wait, and not worth it. They have some interesting things for snacks which are pretty good.  I've had one of their bagels and it was just great. But honestly, the wait for everything is just too long.
author: Sandra P.

description:
Stellar and amazing as always.  Every Philz location has incredibly friendly staff who are very knowledgeable and accommodating. 

Any of their pastries are great as well and I would recommend anything they have in their store.
author: Laura D.

description: I love the mint mojito ice coffee on a hot day and the Sumatra hot coffee on a cold day. This place redefined the coffee experience for me.
author: Chad T.

description:
Add another 5-star rating to the list, not that they need one!

I had to find a coffee shop in the Civic Center area to wait for some friends. Am I ever glad I found this one! Philz is what coffee shops should be. Based on Yelp reviews, I'm not sure if it would live up to the hype, but as soon as I took a sip of my iced coffee, I was in heaven. I want one of those every single day. Perfectly creamy and strong, with a little bit of foam on top. I wanted another as soon as I was done (which was probably a few minutes).

The coffee shop is spacious, has lots of comfy couches and outlets, and very laid back. it wasn't the hipster, pretentious coffee shop I was expecting it to be, but rather staffed by super friendly, helpful, genuinely nice baristas. They asked me if it was my first time and made recommendations from the huge menu of artisan coffees and teas. Drinks are around $3 - $5, and they also had tasty-looking assortments of pastries, breakfast burritos, bottled drinks, and other snacks. 

I wish we had one in so cal! Would be a great place to study or do work, or to hang out with a friend.
author: Bridget P.

description: Love the Mint Iced Coffee.  Its well made, the perfect amount of mint, sweetness and coffee! I also tried the New Manhattan and while at first sip it was delicious, I wouldn't be afraid to ask for more sweetness!
author: Sunita P.

description: DELICIOUS! First time ever having it and definitely not the last. The mint mojito iced coffee is all you need. Can't wait to have it again in Los Angeles.
author: Candice G.

description:
Philz Coffee took care of me today. They made a mistake but then made up for it. Here's the story:

This morning I rushed out of my house and into a Lyft to get to my first day of jury duty by 8:45 AM. I arrived right on time but there was a HUGE line and I hadn't had any coffee or breakfast yet. When I saw the line, I looked up "coffee" on my trusted Yelp app and was thrilled to find out that there was a Philz 0.2 miles away. I've tried a cup of Philz but never been into a Philz coffee shop before. 

I used my speed-walking skills to get me into Philz fast. The line was long-ish but moved very quickly with the efficient set-up. I chose my coffee and the barista asked if I wanted it "dark or medium" and then "sweet or not so sweet." Without coffee and never having been to Philz before, this did not translate to milk or sugar to me and instead I just answered the questions. Then I went to pay at the cashier and chose the ginger scone to munch on (very good but I had decision remorse that I hadn't chosen the Philz bagel with cucumbers, etc. but I can have that next time!).

I then eagerly awaited my coffee- the original barista who'd started making my coffee had swapped out and someone else finished it for me and told me I was doing good by going to jury duty. I walked out thrilled with my coffee and tasted it - it was delicious... but creamy. Unfortunately I'm self-diagnosed lactose intolerant and soon I had an awful stomach ache. I sadly threw out the rest of my coffee.

When I did not get picked for the jury around 2:45 pm, I hustled back over to Philz and re-ordered my coffee but was very specific that I'd like soy milk and an equal. I explained to the cashier what had happened this morning and she sweetly apologized and said this coffee was definitely on the house. The Turkish coffee that I chose (for the second time today) was just perfect and I LOVED it! I hope for more Philz soon... but hopefully no more jury duty!
author: Meghan P.

description:
It's hard to find a coffee chain that ruins all other coffee chains for you. 

In the city, there are many artisan and fancy-shmancy coffee joints that have perfected the espresso and cappuccino. But sometimes, ahem, like every Friday, you just want a solidly delicious cup of coffee. If that's the case, go to Philz! 

Everyone is friendly. On the huge menu of coffees and teas, there's a short description next to each one. 

My favorite part of the Philz experience? You tell the lovely person behind the counter exactly what you want, Tesora, light cream & light sugar please! And then they make it, almost always perfectly. 

Word to the new goer: You stand in line for your delicious coffee and then you stand in line to pay/order pastries. Don't worry, it's worth the two lines.
author: Ashley S.

description:
Really in love with Philz Coffee. We stopped in Philz for a short break.

We had the most popular MINT MOJITO. I also ordered Mocha Tesora.

Mint Mojito Ice Coffee - really good coffee, creative and refreshing. It comes with a nice mint leaf on top for pretty decoration, once you get to the bottom of the coffee, you will notice there are loads of mint leaves.

Mocha Tesora (Ice) - MY FAVORITE!! Rich chocolate, creamy, absolutely delicious! I got me light sweetness, you can get light, medium, or normal sweetness. I do not have a super sweet tooth, and the light version taste perfect. You can also get it extra strong.

Will definitely go back for more Mocha Tesora!
author: Sandi C.

description:
Great service and very friendly staff. Was my first time here. I love how they fresh brew everything one cup at a time. This method allows them to change strength of coffee which my friends and I took full advantage of this feature. 

Everything we got was good from coffee to tea and the hot chocolate. Not pricey
author: James A.

description: This place is so adorbs! It was right next to the Orpheum so we popped in, grabbed a coffee and walked down to union square. It was super fast and easy here, people were nice .... the bathroom looked terrible. But eh, it's a bathroom.
author: Marevie T.

description:
After having some horrible four barrel coffee with almond milk at a newish place on Divisadero,felling ripped off and otherwise disgusted. I decided I needed some real coffee. 

That's what Philz has, REAL coffee and its real good. Do not be fooled by bright lights and all the other bells and whistles other coffee shops try to get you in the door with. 
I will travel a a great distance to get the good stuff. So far Philz is the one place in SF I can go and get a great cup. 

The Tesora. 
Done. 
Well done!

You can get it the right way, the way YOU want it! Not the way others think you should want it.
author: Ben M.

description: I love Philz! Staff at this location was great and friendly. Our particular barista (forgot her name, SORRY!!!!!!!) was an awesome, spunky lady who knew what she was doing and made my gingerbread coffee on point! She was crushing on my bestfriend (who was visiting from Orlando) so it made our experience more fun...funny. Great place, great quality coffee, overall great service. They know their shizz and are good at it! Go there now.
author: Clarissa M.

description: First time experience at Philz and had amazing service from Noah.  He was very patient and walked me through how to order.  He even gave mm tip on how to order more efficiently the next time that I order.  It was great service and great coffee.  I will definitely go back again.
author: L W.

description:
Philz is the flippin best. I haven't been able to go back to my own coffee machine after this opened.

My go-to coffee order is the large Philtered Soul with regular cream and sugar. It's got this amazing smooth, nutty texture that just brightens any morning.

I've also tried their cinnamon roll. It's not like your traditional cinnamon roll because instead of being bready it's more flaky, kind of like the layers of a baklava. It was delicious, though, and the prefect accompaniment to a warm coffee.

Everything about this location is perfect. It's spacious, clean, and well-lit. It's got the exact right amount of tables and couches. It's a great place to study - I've never had problems finding a study table. The tables are large enough, too - not like those dinky coffee tables where you could barely fit a book. There are different size tables for individuals and pairs or for groups. 

The staff are friendly and accommodating. They always make sure that they made your order perfectly. 

Sometimes when it's busy, you have to be a little patient with your order/paying, but it's totally worth it. If you're grabbing your coffee to go, remember to grab a little stopper for your lid in one of those tiny metal cups. Helps a lot with preventing spillage!
author: Jamie C.

description:
I swears this place always busy, busy, busy. With the recent heat wave the consumption of the mojito iced coffee slowed things way down. The drink is that popular. Anyway, the staff is fun and the coffee is good. The space is usually very crowded and not too many seats are available. I'm impatient so I get distracted and annoyed but that's my problem.

Good chain, Starbucks will buy them soon. Mark my words
author: Tommy W.

description:
I love their coffee! Another must-try favorite in SF!

Ambiance: Great place to sit down and drink some coffee, chat with a friend, or do some work, write Yelp reviews with their free Wi-Fi. Lots of tables, chairs, and couches.

My favorite drinks are the "Mint Mojito Iced Coffee" and the "Mocha Tesora." Prices range from $3-4 for a small, and $4-5 for a large.

Staff: Very friendly and they make each drink fresh and with lots of love.

Great alternative for tasty coffee (if you get tired/bored of Starbucks!). :)
author: Lily Y.

description: Today was the grand opening day and everyone gets FREE COFFEE!!!!!  I've passed by here couple times while heading to the Van Ness location and lo and behold, they're finally opened today!  First of all, anything FREE will draw crazy crowds and since it's Philz, it draws a bigger crowd.  Although it was a mad house, I had a speedy barista creating my Mint Mojito w/ soy just right :) I can't wait to visit this spot on a regular basis!!!
author: Katie N.

description:
Was skeptical of the new location.  However I was SO VERY pleasantly surprised to find this new location was mellower than the Van Ness store.  

Less lines, less ppl, less sweaty. It is bigger, brighter, newer, and less busy than the Van Ness location.  Don't get me wrong I love the Van Ness store too.  The new location only further ads to my allegiance and reverence to the Philz Empire.  It is just a nice place. Philz just does it right.
author: Chelsey G.

description: As long as Philz continues to have Pepple's donuts, I will keep coming here for my black or green tea fix. This location seems to get pretty busy at times, but they get the orders out fast and it's only really a problem if you were looking to hang out inside.
author: Jon T.

description: I lost my Philz virginity last week with a Mint mojito!!!  That is all.
author: Kevin C.

description:
So if you read my other review about the Philz on Van Ness street, you'll know how much I love the Mint Mojito Iced Coffee. I came to this location after the one on Van Ness ran out of mint (no idea how that even happens when it seems to be one of the most popular drinks they have). 

This location had tons of mint, was even larger and roomier, and had a nice feel to it. This location was a lifesaver as I really wanted to get a cup to take on the road with me for the drive back to LA. Thanks guys.
author: Jonathan F.

description:
I LOVE PHILZ! 

For those on your laptops, this location has better tables and chairs than the original 24th ST spot, reminds me of the Palo Alto and Turk-Van Ness location.
author: Jess C.

description:
I love a Philz Coffee and its a great that there is one so close to my work now. 
Every time I need a sweet coffee drink, I walk over to Philz for a sweet and creamy Mint Mojito. 

Whenever I go, there is a short line and the service is speedy.
author: Theresa D.

description:
Super friendly.  This place had a bunch of different blends, which was pretty good.  The mint mojito ice coffee is pretty decadent.  Loved it.  Get it with less sugar... 

I had their Ambrosia Coffee of the Gods, black.  Medium roast.  It was definitely on the acidic side.  I'd probably temper it down with a little cream next time.  I typically take my coffee black, but this one was definitely a little strong.

The setup is a little different than other coffee places.  You order first with a barista, then pay at the cashier after.  I'm too used to Starbucks / Coffee Bean where you pay at the cashier, who takes your order. 

The decor is pretty cool. I like the touch of having random facts about your barista pasted on the chalkboards underneath them.
author: Richie W.

description: I can do without the mint mojito (not my thing) but I do really enjoy the Tesoro coffee and the vanilla bean scone. The location on Larkin is bigger and the staff is nicer than the one on VanNess.
author: Semuteh F.

description:
I can only think that all those 5-star ratings are shills, stockholders, or people who also like Starbucks.

The WORST mocha I have ever had in my entire rather extended life. $3 donuts and cookies? Seriously? 

Eek! Methinks not.
author: Joseph T.

description: My girlfriend wanted to come here very badly to try their famous coffee, so we took a cab and were stuck for 45min in traffic, when we entered my gf needed to use the restroom, a lady called Tomie yelled at us, i tought it was candit camera, I couldnt believe what I was hearing. Never Ive been so rudely treated! I can understand that sometimes it gets frustrating to tell the customers they need to buy something first before using the restroom but some politeness wouldnt hurt! Iv never been so mistreated at any place before. Never ever coming back!!
author: Simon W.

description: I am a big fan of Phillz Coffee. The reason why I am giving this location 2 stars is that I witnessed an employee sweep-off a table with a broom she has just used on the floor. This location is in the heart of the TL where human waste is impossible to avoid. In essence she had just brushed feces from the floor on to the table.
author: Asa H.

description:
Heheheheheehehheeeee :-D just wanted to be another to add 5 stars.

There is no better coffee than Philz. 

Period.

Cafe Trieste is amaze-balls

Blue Bottle is super incredible as well, love their mocha's

But they are not named after the coolest dude, who really created something special. 

Ice coffee at Philz is otherworldly

I live close to the Van Ness location but closer to this Golden Gate spot. So now unfortunately what was a slight addiction has turned into a full blown problem!

Oh well . . . . . good for them
author: A L.

description:
Big fan of this location of Philz. 
Pros - obviously their coffee but that goes without saying, very open space, lots of seating, clean space. 

Cons - the space is a little bit dark, I wouldn't have complained if it was a little bit brighter inside.
author: Marilyn M.

description:
I was going to give up on Philz Coffee.  After trying it multiple times ordering something different and not finding it satisfying enough for me, Ginger Snap Iced Coffee has made me pause and rethink Philz.
I like my coffee black and strong, forget the sugar cause it's not needed.  Here's what's wrong with Philz from my multiple times trying.  Too diluted when I ordered Turkish, too much ice when I ordered the Ecstatic, and too much sugar from their other iced coffee.
Then I found Ginger Snap Iced Coffee.  The barista warned me it was going to be sweet and creamy, so I asked to make as non sweet as possible.  Pretty perfect, cause it really tasted good.  The ginger snap was strong, blended well with the coffee taste.  
Philz isn't going to be my primary coffee stop if all I need is a strong black coffee.  But if I'm in need of something flavorful, I'll be back for the Ginger Snap.
author: Karen L.

description: sign me the FUCK up good shit go sHit thats  some goodshit rightth  ere rightthere if i do a so my selｆ  i say so  thats what im talking about right there right there (chorus:  ) mMMMM  O0ＯOOＯOOooo        Good shit
author: Jeff M.

description:
I had 30 minutes to kill. I got a hot cocoa. It was good. Was surrounded by lots of other Hastings students and professors, as well as AOC/ California Supreme Court employees. 

This is way better than the law cafe's coffee... but show me a law student that has 5 minutes to wait for a cup of coffee- especially at 8:30 am or on their 10 minute class break...? I don't. 

Its a huge space though, and kind of nice when you have time to hang there. Staffers are very nice. My choice for coffee near Hastings.
author: Emily D.

description:
A stone-throw away from Civic Center BART, and next to UC Hastings Law School, this Philz location caters to people in suits and students with laptops.

Reasonably spacious for a cafe, there's plenty of seating. All good for casual talk, though it gets loud at times.  When I bring my computer and they run out of outlets, I head for the Van Ness location which is quieter and two blocks away.

Minor, but this location gets chilly when the door stays open from unmindful patrons and winds fill the room.  Fall or Winter? Bring a jacket.

Also they insist on bathroom codes. Inconvenient, but effective at deterring the less-appealing transients of the TL.

Coffee wise, Tesora is most popular--sweet, smooth and full-bodied.  When I'm in the mood for darker stronger coffee, which is always,  I get "Aromatic Arabic."  All drinks can be soy (vanilla or plain), iced or hot.   Ordering sounds obnoxious depending on the flavor ("Anesthesia to the Upside" is one I will never order on account of its name)--but small interpersonal price for delighting at one of the best coffee joints in the Bay.
author: Roel M.

description:
I had one sip of the mint mojito iced coffee... And it was game over.

I am really sensitive to caffeine so I avoid drinking any coffee past 2 p.m.  When I purchased the mint mojito iced coffee at 5 p.m., I was planning to only take a few sips, just for the sake of trying it.  By 6 p.m., I had finished the whole cup, and I was tempted to order another.

I don't even like mint very much, let alone whole mint leaves.  But Philz changed me.  Small pieces of mint swim gracefully in a pool of dark, divine elixir (aka Philz coffee), and they together create wonderfulness that I have never experienced before.

~('-')~
author: Heidi S.

description:
Amazing service, personable staff, a great place to get my day started.  Got a large Jacob's Wonderbar light-light using the orderahead app today, which let me order my drink on the way to Philz and it was ready at a separate counter when I got there (let me bypass the entire line at 10:00AM on a Sunday!).  If you'd like to sign up, use https://www.orderaheadapp.com/r/5H8C?m=35 for a free first drink, it's an awesome service to help you cut the line.

#philzeveryday
author: Trevor G.

description: This is a full service coffee house, no espresso drinks. Staff was extremely helpful on my first visit and made me a great coffee with whole milk, similar to my typical fav, a latte. Would definitely go again!
author: Andrea G.

description: There is a variety of interesting coffees here, I wish I had more time to try more of them. I did enjoy the coffee it is just hard to give 5 star once you have tried their compettion in the area.
author: Iris G.

description:
Ambience similar to an upgraded Starbucks with additional sofa. 

The drinks are superb, except that I am somehow allergic to either the honey or mint leaves they put in the tea. 

Will go next time just for coffee. They should add a desert line.
author: Bai H.

description: So you can do the Starbucks thing, but Philz serves coffee. I mean awesome full flavored coffee. Today I had their incredible Mint Mojito Iced Coffee. Great coffee flavor and an entire mint plant (our so it seemed).
author: Gary J.

description:
Philz in the Tenderloin is the best thing that could ever happen to the Tenderloin! Having gone to Hastings, I wish they had been there all 3 years that I studied there. I would have resided on their comfy couches and have had meetings/dates with folks on their cool wooden benches and chairs.

I also like the Philz culture. All the folks that have ever made me a cup of coffee are super down to earth and super caffeinated! So you can imagine how great of an experience Philz is.

OH yeah-the coffee...My favorites are Tantalizing Turkish-it was my first love. I also love Jacob's Wonderbar, the ever-so- famous mint Mojito, and if you want to bounce off the walls then get the Ecstatic Iced Coffee!

I would say if you are visiting San Francisco, you can't leave without trying this coffee spot. It's a San Francisco icon.
author: Judith G.

description: Not someplace I'd get addicted to, but definitely a unique brand of its own! I respect and admire their company concept very much. Their grand range of drip selection is impressive and quite special.
author: Grace C.

description: Love love Philz, purely for the unique iced mint mojito.  That is all.
author: Angela V.

description: What an experience! I went in with my spanish speaking parents having to order/translate for them and also overwhelmed by not knowing what to/how to order. There was a short haired asian cool as woman who took her time to listen to what I like in coffee and also what my parents did. She was so patient and wanted to make sure we were happy with our drink. She asked us to tried it once it was made to make sure it was what we wanted and told me if we changed our mind at some point about sweetness to just come back to her. The coffee was amazing and by far the best cup of coffee I have had in my life but also the service was so great which added to my experience. I wish there was one of this in Austin with friendly staff too.
author: Hanlly S.

description: The best Philz location in the city! Much larger than most, and the service is infinitely better than the Philz only a few blocks away on Van Ness. I always pop by here either before my day starts or on my lunch break, and even with a long line ahead of me, never have to wait too long for my coffee. Pro tip: if you're looking for a good caffeine kick/pick-me-up, order the peru light! It's not on the menu but the employees tipped me off to it, and it's been a lifesaver.
author: Angela L.

description:
Love the coffee here, and the people are friendly too! 

The bathroom could be cleaner.
author: Lola P.

description:
I was pleasantly surprised to find this location.  A group of us had eaten lunch on a weekend up the street, & as we were walking this way (I don't remember where we were headed), noticed that there was a Philz.  So of course, we went in & got some drinks to go.  

I tend to get their ice drinks, the iced ecstatic & mint mojito.  If you'd like a hot cup of coffee, & you aren't sure what you want (there's not really much description on the menu), let the barista know what you like, & they will help you with recommendations.  

As far as I know, they're all set up kind of the same way, with one line that feeds to several spots at the counter.  Once you order, you can go pay, & then you pick up your drink from the barista you ordered from when it's ready.

Street parking.  There's a garage at Civic Center too.  We had parked further away over in Hayes Valley & walked over from where we were before lunch, so I wasn't paying that much attention to the parking situation.  

Located on the southeast corner of Golden Gate & Larkin.
author: Linda T.

description: Awesome philz location. Usually pretty crowded but that's because people love chilling/working here. The barista made me a tasty Tantalizing Turkish dark roast with mint, with the right amount of cream and sugar without me really specifying, so cool. Give it a try if you want a less sweet alternative to the decadent mint mojito!
author: Linus W.

description: I went with my boyfriend in the early afternoon. I got a hot mocha tesora with medium sweetness, and it was brilliant! My boyfriend got a hot mint mojito coffee. His tasted great as well, but he basically had a mint salad in his drink - the only reason I'm not rating this 5-star.
author: Alyssa P.

description: Who doesn't love Philz?  Best coffee in SF.  Ecstatic Iced Coffee is delicious on a hot day.  Love Itz the Best and Tesora when it's a bit more chilly.
author: Ted K.

description: Being from Sacramento I had been waiting to try Philz Coffee for a long time. I can't tell you how many facebook and instragram posts I see from friends having drinks at Philz on a weekly basis. I have to admit my visit to Philz fulfilled expectations of great tasting quality coffee with friendly service. I was intrigued by the different systems and everything going on behind the counter. While it there wasn't a long wait it took a little over 8 minutes to actually get our drink. I loved the flavor but they seemed kinda pricy. The large was $5 and it was about the size of a medium or small (since it was filled with a lot of ice) everywhere. Despite the price, it's likely I will come back again for their quality and specialty coffee. After all everything is more expensive in the city anyway.
author: Cindy S.

description:
Hands down, the best cup of coffee in SF.
If you like a dark roast, the Ether, dark and smoky, is out of this world. 
This location, while only a few blocks from the Van Ness shop, offers more seating, and is located adjacent to all of the government buildings around Civic Center. 
If you're trying to work here, it can be loud and very crowded.
author: Teryll H.

description: This place is great and I come here all the time. Wonderful, patient staff. But today was the first time I've used the restroom here and although I wasn't expecting a nice bathroom (it's a busy place), I was shocked to see an OPEN biohazard box filled with syringes on the ground.  I live in the Tenderloin and I'm sick of seeing needles on the ground, so while I appreciate a needle disposal site, most biohazard boxes have only a small opening so no one can get to the contents. What if a kid was in the bathroom?! Please buy a new disposal box and secure it to a wall for god sakes.
author: Nicole C.

description:
I came in a newbie and I left a self-proclaimed-soon-to-be-regular.

Semi-edited transcript of my first visit:

Super Cool Barista: Hey.
Me: *way too excited* Hi.
Super Cool Barista: What can I get for you today?
Me: What's the strongest coffee I can get?
Super Cool Barista: Like, caffeine-wise? I'd definitely go with the "Greater Alarm."
Me: *without hesitation* Okay! I'll take that! A large, please! Black.

And, let me tell you: that was the best coffee of my life. It instantly perked me up and the taste of the coffee was perfection. 

I take my coffee black, but they can put whatever you want into your coffee while they brew it. They really have made coffee into an art form.

Another favorite of mine is the "Ecstatic Iced Coffee." I don't know how they do it, but it tasted sweet, smooth and chocolately without anything in it.

Amazing. Just amazing.
author: Gabriela K.

description: The coffee is incredible and it's worth the price to spend 5 minutes around people who clearly absolutely love their job. Oh, and Hastings students get a discount!
author: Kaitlin V.

description:
Philz is a strange cafe. They serve drinks in paper to-go cups even when you're staying, and don't let you tip on your credit card, although the baristas assure you it's fine and not to feel guilty you don't have cash. What's up with this place?

Then again, the coffees are amazing, the teas are pretty good and they're playing The Smiths as I write this, so on balance, life's good here.
author: Scott F.

description:
THE. BEST. COFFEE. EVAAAAA! 
It just tastes different and it's so addictive. 
My favorite is the Philharmonic with mint. Sweet & Creamy. If you live in San Francisco and you have never tried Philz, then you're missing out real big. :P
author: Emily J.

description:
I love when a barista can remember my order. And they do just that at this location! It adds a personal touch to my experience when I go to a coffee spot. The baristas here are always friendly and they always make my Ecstatic Iced Coffee perfectly. 

Order it "Philz way" for a medium sweet/medium cream or "sweet and creamy" for your iced coffee to taste like a cup of melted Haagen Dazs coffee ice cream. Definitely something worth calorie splurging on once in a while. 

This Philz is particularly spacious, not overly crowded with outlet dwellers, and seems to have climate control. It's never too hot or cold at this location. The free wifi is a major plus and the connection is never slow. 

This location IS in the Tenderloin. You get a good dose of drug addicts and dealers roaming around the area but there's also a bunch of cops and firefighters coming through to this location. +1 for the occasional eye candy ;P 

Pro tip: The doors have door stoppers and DO NOT swing out all the way. If you push too hard, the door will swing back at you and you might drop your cup of gold!
author: Jessica L.

description: Best Philz location yet. Same great coffee, but way better service than the tiny one on Van Ness. Especially from Darlene. And the decor. Industrial loft. I bet if they opened further south on Market, they would get inundated by the Twitters of SF. I dunno what else there is to say. Oh, please starting serving half and half.
author: Kris P.

description: Coffee here is great. I like to have a bagel with the coffee, so I'm dropping a star because of the recent switch to Authentic Bagels that Philz has made. Does anyone know who the previous bagel supplier was? They were great. Authentic, not so much...
author: James P.

description:
Good spot in a crappy area . . . well almost crappy area. I like Phil'z Coffee's drinks. This time I had some iced coffee thing and it was delicious! the thing I don't like is ordering with one person and then having to tell the cashier what you ordered again to pay. It makes the customer work for them.
This location is clean and modern which is nice because the area gets shady real fast if you don't know where you're going. IF you do know where you're going then you're all good. My coffee partner says that this is his second favorite Phil'z next to the one on 24th St.

picky, picky, picky
author: Lizzy M.

description:
Needed a spot to waste some time prior to a meeting and went in here. 

Inside was nicer than I expected for the area. It was very "coffee house" chic with tables and couches etc. I actually think they could put way more seating in here than they currently have. 

So I have never been in a Phil'z before so I can't speak to the chain/location thing, but I will say that I really enjoyed both the experience (having a barista really delve into your order and the options surrounding that) and then watching them prepare each cup. It made the price (which is on par with Starbucks/chains) worthwhile. 

It is loud in here. We had 5 of us and it was hard to hear. It also looks like people get here and park themselves (and their laptops) in available seating, so there wasn't much to find available. I didn't use the joint bathroom (NEVER my ideal) but I was told it favored the men (which tells me it wasn't a "sit-able" spot). 

I had the Mocha Tesoro and it was wonderful. All in all a nice find.
author: Carol L.

description:
Couple of friends of mine were hitting a nearby club for snacks (if you know the area, you know the type I'm talking about), so I popped into Philz for my own brand of pick-me-up.  This is a great location in the Philz empire.  Fast, friendly staff, open space, lots of comfy seating, and a reasonable number of outlets.  The line was long, but they processed us really quickly.  I think it was ~10 minutes between getting in line and getting my drink, which was made to the usual high standards I've come to expect from Philz.  Mint Mojito Iced, you're everything I want a mixed coffee drink to be.

The vibe is suprisingly laid back given that UC San Francisco's Hastings College of Law is around the corner.  Lots of would be lawyers studying, along with some VERY attractive and flirty locals.  I'm not the kind of guy who picks up girls in coffee places.  But, the ones I ran into at the Civic Center Philz were all very friendly/chatty.  Not typical of the average San Francisco coffee shop.

Parking was surprisingly good.  We managed to score a spot half a block down Golden Gate.  However, it was by a college during summer on a Sunday afternoon.  I imagine Monday morning in the fall, the situation is entirely different.  Then again, I don't usually recommend driving anywhere in the city.  The Civic Center BART stop is pretty close, along with several other mass transit options.  The area can be a little sketch at night, but I've never been worried during the day.

Through a strange confluence of events, I ended up with TWO large Mint Mojito Iced Coffees and no takers for the extra.  The extra energy was good.  The evening ended up being CRAAAAAAZY.
author: Chubbypanda ..

description:
This is just an overall review for Philz and all their locations. 

I. love. Philz. 

I initially tried the mint mojito iced coffee because its the signature specialty drink everyone raves about... but you know what? I didn't like it so much. Not even Philz's way. What I actually love is the ecstatic iced coffee. Wow. I like more traditional coffee flavors and more mocha, buttery and nutty flavors. This coffee has a blend of beans that has all of that! Can't order anything else.

At every Philz, everyone is friendly and attentive. I like that after my drink is made, they always let me taste it and make sure that it's just the way I like it. :) (sweetened with WHOLE milk. yup!)

One time, I was at the Mission location and actually met Phil! He was just standing there randomly hanging out outside the store and I recognized him from his Instagram. He's a cool guy who has great coffee. 

Like all great coffee shops in this caffeine driven city, its not cheap, but it's well made coffee and so delicious. I go maybe once a week. Treat yoself!
author: Maureen B.

description:
Mint Mojitoooooo! 

Who knew that you could turn a tasty and refreshing alcoholic beverage into an equally delicious coffee drink? I was really excited to try this since I've seen so many people talk about it! And luckily, the drink did not disappoint. It takes a while for the barista to make the drink but it is well worth the wait. There is a large amount of actual mint in your drink! That surprised me but I welcome all the mint with open arms. It just instantly calms me. All in all, the Mint Mojito is a must try :)
author: Katie H.

description: I was able to FINALLY get here and have the famous mint mojito iced coffee.  It's really good, but $5 for a large that's not even that big of a cup and chock-full of ice.  It's tasty, sweet, creamy, and just a darn good coffee flavor with mint.  Very quaint spot, with their "cafe" right there for more seating.  I would go broke here if I had one of these bad boys everyday, but I would gladly have other high quality drinks too.
author: Scott F.

description:
Ok...let me say this first...Philz Coffee is AMAZING! I get mine with cream and sugar. The cream they use is frothy as they like to shake it up before pouring it in. Gives the coffee some body. 

This location is cozy and has a lot of tables and couches and chairs. Love it. I like the corner location with the windows...keeps it from getting claustrophobic in there. 

So why 3 stars??? The staff. Somehow they all look miserable. The staff makes ordering coffee awkward... It's almost as if I feel bad for "bothering" them but then I remember that I am there to enjoy a nice cup of joe and that they are there to help me with that. 

I guess I am a masochist because I keep coming back. That's how good the coffee is.

I do want to thank Philz for letting me use their free wifi to write this review. Thanks!
author: Tara K.

description:
This place is amazing and I am glad I don't live or work too nearby any of its locations otherwise I would be here everyday multiple times per day.  

The baristas are incredibly friendly, patient, and helpful.  The menu is extensive and includes an ample number of decaf options which is unusual.  They are also more than willing to customize a drink without batting an eye or giving attitude.  Great coffee!!
author: Andrea L.

description: Good grief.  A pal that moved here from the East used to praise Peets, but i always thought it was meh. Philz makes a great coffee. Holy shite.
author: Kris E.

description:
Philz Coffee is one of the most talked about coffee joints in the bay area so my boyfriend and I decided to go give it a try. The place was packed with people sitting down and enjoying their coffees - a very friendly environment and a place great for studying! 

The drink:

Mint Mojito Iced Coffee - 3 stars - probably the most well-known drink people order (especially first timers like us) but it was nothing THAT extraordinary. The drink was refreshing, since they used real mint leaves, but it lacked coffee taste and was a bit watered down. The baristas put an excess amount of ice in the drink also so you are not really getting your money's worth. (I wish I tried the chai latte instead)

Overall, we will still return because the ambience is comfortable and the coffee is a step up from Starbucks. Perhaps I just expected more since this place has been raved by so many of our friends.
author: Vivian L.

description:
(Cut and paste my other Philz reviews here)

Same fantastic coffee. The difference between this Philz and the one on Van Ness? Space. Lots of it. No need to breathe down other customers necks. Unless that's your thing. Don't be a creeper.
author: Michelle B.

description:
It's nice to have a philz closer to where I currently live but in my opinion, its not as good as the one in the mission. 

I mean its still a good mint mojito but I feel like when I get my min mojitos in the mission they are a bit more flavorful.

Still a great location and a great space! They have free wifi and delish coffee and snack options. Also its close to the civic center bart station so when me and the bf are out and about in the mornings, we usually try to stop off here for our morning fix of good coffee!
author: Christine W.

description: What do they put in this?!! Even though its kind of expensive for a cup of coffee (5 bucks) for a mint mojito, it's amazing and I always want to get one when I walk by or after lunch. The workers are friendly and helpful, lines are fast, drinks are great, what more can you ask for?
author: Q W.

description:
Highlights
- My absolute favorite Philz location in the city. Although it is close to the ghetto, it's one of the bigger locations. 
- They have a really good distinct line area and plenty of space for various baristas to take drinks on busier mornings. 
- Seating is not a problem nor is the abundance of outlets. This is a pretty good study spot complete with a bathroom if needed. 
- All time favorite drinks: Ecstatic iced coffee and Mint Mojito. 
- Their Philz bagel is pretty bomb (cream cheese, tomatoes, and cucumbers) and they even serve Pepple's vegan doughnuts. 

Improvements
- Metered street parking that can be difficult to find later in the mornings unless you are willing to park on the ghetto side of the street. 

Tip
- Download the Order Ahead app. It will save you a lot of time, so all you have to do is run in to pick up your drink. All paid for and transaction done via the app. Thank me later!
author: Tracy T.

description:
This is a great location especially since it's near my job! What can I say that hasn't already been said. The coffee and baristas working their butts off are all awesome!
The line moves fast and at times I feel too fast! 
There is ample seating, some
Snacks, and a bathroom...parking sucks.

If you haven't been here yet, then get on down here!
author: Molly M.

description: I think mint mojo iced coffees are my favorite summer treat (errr dessert coffee).  Love Philz.
author: natasha m.

description: Besides price (which I know everyone probably complains about), everything else about this place is perfect. Coffee is great, the staff is friendly, the only downside to this place is the homeless people surrounding it sometimes.
author: Da X.

description:
Philz Coffee - Itz thee BEST

So glad they have a location here. Even though 15 federal officers walked in, at least I was in front of them in line! LOL

* the Mint Mojito iced coffee is like crack... I always want to order two of them...
author: Michelle W.

description:
You know that feeling that you get when you realize you don't have money to pay because you left your wallet in your other purse?!?

I do.

Bless the guy behind the counter. He comped me my coffee when he saw how stupid I felt. Positive karma! I will return to give them a super tip!
author: Jay H.

description:
I like Philz, but they really need to start 

1. Having the baristas put the tops on the coffee cups.  

2.  Having coffee cup sleeves.  I know their cups are semi insulated, but it's still not insulated enough.  They always feel almost too hot to hold.  I wind up having to use a napkin as a impromptu coffee sleeve. 

This morning I dropped my cup virtually as soon as I picked it up, because it was so hot (or perhaps the cup was unusually flimsy?  Usually Philz cups are pretty sturdy but this one seemed weaker than usual).  Since the top hadn't been put on yet, I wound up losing all of my coffee.  And that sucks because now I'm without caffeine for the morning.  This would not have happened if the baristas would put the tops on, or if the cups came with insulated sleeves.
author: Joseph B.

description:
I've been to several different Philz locations throughout my SF visits and this by far has been the worst customer service ever. 

Yes, I get it. Philz coffee is the bomb diggity. Attracting all the hipsters and coffee drinkers in the norcal area, what is there not to like about this place? 

Well, listen. I get that you are highly raved about. But does that warrant your pretentious attitude towards those customers like me who accidentally spilled some coffee since I was a little clumsy while transferring my drink to the table? 

I apologized profusely, yet your snarky barista had to wittingly say in a very condescending tone that I should be more careful next time since the coffee is filled to the brim. I see it girl. I was just not careful as I hustled excitedly to my table to satiate my caffeine craving. 

The cashier was also pretty pompous and deprecating towards myself and my friend (first timer) as he explained where to line up and pay for the coffee. Great. You just lost a new customer and annoyed a previously loyal customer. Good job.

I guess when you're a hotshot in coffee land, this justifies some employees to be a little pompous about their line of work. Congrats for being the rudest people I've met in SF thus far!
author: Tiffany K.

description:
I've noticed that many people are a fan of Philz here in the city. I usually have their mocha and it does taste much better than other mochas I've had. It is thicker, heartier and has definitely a stronger coffee flavor. I have a sweet tooth so when asked about the sweetness, I specify "very sweet" and I haven't had complaints about it.
It is a little unusual that you order your drink first and then pay for it. Nothing wrong with it but I was not aware of it so I felt a bit confused at first.
author: Dodi G.

description: Why couldnt this be open all the time like Golden Gate Croissant? Unlike the latter, this place is newish, clean and their selections are good. GGC has been there forever and in the wee hours, it's the only thing open, which in some cases you'll be hanging out with SFPD. But during the day, they know better and are over here at Philz. Went out of my normal routine and got the ginger snap iced coffee. Basically a normal ecstatic but with spices. It was good but I think Ill stick to the normal ecstatic from here on out. Old habits are hard to break sometimes.
author: Kim N.

description:
I normally hate coffee that has not been pressed by a more-than-15 bar espresso machine, and that makes me barely go to Philz. 
Their chocolate is good but that is not the reason why I am writing this review. This review is for this branch only. I like how friendly the baristas here are, and how nice its ambience is.  The place is bright and spacious. Good place to work quietly on a brief, or catch up with girl friends.
author: Joelle K.

description:
Ive been here multiple times and their mint mojitos never fail!

$4 for a small mint mojito (mint iced coffee). i have tried other mint iced coffees at other places but nothing compares to this place. This place nails it. It's my favorite shop. Period. 

Really chill place as well. Lots of seating and tables close to outlets for your laptop.  
Their baristas know their coffee and they are really friendly and accommodating. 
I think the sf police frequents this place as well. Every time i'm there, they are also there! 

I see that they serve Jamaican blue mountain coffee for $7 small... Hmm will definitely try that!
author: Stacy P.

description: Dear Philz Coffee, I love you so much. Best coffee ever. So strong & delicious. Will you please open a store in Portland, OR? We need you!
author: A M.

description: I LOVE Jacob's Wonderbrew.  When I am on a work adventure and have to trek into the tenderloin a bit, I always treat myself to a cup of Philz.  I love this new location.  it is roomy, plenty of staff and space both for the customers and the baristas.  craving some Philz now.
author: Jennifer L.

description: This is by far the strongest coffee I'v ever had. Whatever you're doing, keep doing it! I've never had a weak cup; even iced ones are still strong! Going to this location to grab coffee before class is definitely worth it.
author: Lisa N.

description: I love the coffees here. Obviously the mint Mojito is a must try. But the regular hot coffees are great. I like mine with cream and medium sweetened. New fave- blond roast (something) Manhattan. Yum!
author: Nina M.

description:
Okay just like every other human being living in San Francisco, I am shamelessly in love with Philz. They are just terrific and there's nothing to argue. Top quality coffee, unparalleled customer service and always free wifi. Probably one of my favorite things about San Francisco. The one on 24th and Mission is the original and funkiest, but this one is closest to my place. 
Tip: If you like Philtered Soul (which used to be my go-to) try the Red Haze. It's my new favorite, and it's not on the menu!
author: Kalong W.

description:
We all know Philz is known for their mint mojito and time and time again, that is what I always order. This drink just never disappoints. i also enjoy this location because it has a bigger space to sit. 

I definitely had a first good impression of Philz
author: Jie L.

description: Great service. Quick. Love the setup! I love Philz coffee. I order either an iced tantalizing Turkish. Tesora. Or a philtered soul. I do creamy with almond milk. If you like medium sweet then order your drink Philz Way. I even got to meet the owner and he is a chill guy. I want philz to go public so I can invest. Spread the Philz!
author: Kody M.

description: I'm a sucker for that creamy mint mojito, which is a perfect treat after a few hours in the museum nearby. And despite that Philz is absurdly popular, I've generally been able to find a seat and an outlet to plug my laptop charger into while here. A great place to work and sip on a beverage that totally hits the spot.
author: Shendi X.

description:
Why don't we have a Philz in LA?? 
While visiting the area, I happen to walk right by this shop and decided on a cold evening to grab coffee.. 

I was blown away on how good the coffee was. So good, I was literally craving it days later when I returned to home. 

Basically Philz... Bring your coffee shop to LA... Please.
author: Adis M.

description:
Look for Carlos V's review of this location. 

I've experienced the same treatment at least 3x from HER.

Yes, beware the barista (thin, plaid shirt, appears to be of Middle Eastern descent) as she is the absolute RUDEST barista I've ever encountered since I started drinking coffee. And that was many blue moons ago, kids. 

She acts like she's doing you a favor just by taking your order. Barking at customers or totally ignoring them when being spoken to. Acting too damn busy to talk when you ask a simple Yes or No question. 

Maybe that MBA didn't pay off? Special time of month? Every day a bad hair day?

Get a grip. You work in a POSITION OF SERVICE...you're really NOT Cinderella until you get off work and hop into your pumpkin. :)

Yup.

I hope someone in management is reading these reviews. She's gotta go.
 
PS - in all fairness, Philz Coffee rocks (see my review on the original Philz in the Mission). This review is for the barista on Golden Gate Ave.
author: J C.

description:
Whoa man...the coffee here is marvelous!  I usually just like a plain cup o' Joe but Philz puts a few spin on the classic like a sprig of mint and some hazelnut for measure.  You can really taste the quality of the beans.  

There's a reason why people flock to Philz and that's because they got mojo when it comes to coffee yo.
author: Adonis V.

description: Funky to have a Philz in this location, but can't complain about coffee in the T-loin. I guess they're catering to all the people working around City Hall and such. The homeless people that come in and out (and then subsequently hassle you outside) can become an issue, but it's Philz. You know what you're getting. Lots of space to lounge around and free wi-fi. Sometimes, I wonder why everyone is just chilling here on weekday afternoons and not working. Then I remember that I'm in SF. There are also lots of comfy chairs, bro.
author: Danny C.

description: I didn't know this Philz location existed as I don't frequent this area too often, but we discovered it during a recent Asian Heritage Festival.  At Philz, I always get the house iced coffee medium sweet.  Next time, I need to try the mint mojito iced coffee - sounds yum!  Friendly service, can't beat that.
author: Maile N.

description: This place is nice. I wouldn't come here to study, but a nice chat with friends type of place. I love ordering the mojito it's cool and refreshing. I also love that the coffee tastes fresh. Good place for good coffee.
author: Kaitlin V.

description:
I was walking up Larkin when I saw someone walk past me with a Philz coffee cup. Cue the double take. I was like, "How the HELL did this lady walk all the way from Van Ness??" I was thinking that there was no way there could be another location in the area but lo and behold, after I Google Mapped Philz, I was ashamed to discover that I had completely walked past it in my haste to get to an ATM. Apparently this location has been here for a year now and I've been clueless all along! WHOMPS.

I'm still the newbie that hasn't gone for the Mint Mojito, but I did run in and grab their Ecstatic Iced Coffee. I'm iffy on adding sugar but with just cream, it was DELICIOUS. Definitely well worth it! Plus their snacks (had one of their granola pastries) is really substantial. If you're really hungry, they have bagels and other pastries too. The cashier at the front looks like she'd rather be elsewhere but hey, coffee still tastes pretty darn good. I give them an extra plus for having comfy couches and free wifi. And If you need to use their restroom, just ask for the code at the front (it's 24688). 

If you've never been, once you order your coffee, move down to your right to pay (just saying because it looked like there was some confusion around me). They won't take your name but will yell out your order instead. Also, Philz doesn't make your run of the mill mochas and lattes, but I've heard that if you tell them what you usually drink, they can try to mix you up something similar :).
author: Frances L.

description:
Love Philz and this is a great place to grab a cup freshly and individually prepared. I always go with the Ether and light cream. Delicious!

The one drawback about this location is the music. Always too loud and takes away from what could be a super chill experience.
author: N'olo J.

description:
OK, PHILZ has the best coffee, it is FIVE STARS.

The reason this review is lower, is because the other day I ordered a bagel with cream cheese.  I got a bagel that's for sure.  But the amount of cream cheese on it (an added cost of $1.25) was a complete joke.  It was absolutely non-existent, like a tiny little tab of butter.  My associate had the same experience with a bagel and a complete lack of hummus.  I don't know if this is indicative of Philz as a whole or just the person who made our order and her own silliness.  Anyway, that bagel sure was disappointing!
author: eric i.

description: Went miles out of our way to bring overseas visitors here bragging about how good it was. Drinks were lukewarm, flavorless, pricey, and embarrassing. Cafe has uncomfortable worn out crowded seating and long line to the one grimy bathroom stall. Barista constantly rudely flirted with one of our folks too, which was inappropriate as the couple were clearly on a date and uninterested/offended by it. Unprofessional business all around. Disappointing at best.
author: Mr C.

description: Philz Coffee products will always be good. But more than that, it's the atmosphere they provide. It's welcoming and it's easy to grab a seat here and relax/study/work for hours. I also like how they have different types of seating like tall bar stools, couches, and big tables for groups. I also like how they have ample amounts of power outlets. If you're scared about walking through the Tenderloin from Powell St. area, stick to Market St. before turning onto Golden Gate Ave. I'm surprised there are a lot of Philz locations relatively close together in SF.
author: Marlon T.

description: Maybe it's because I'm not a coffee lover but I thought the mint mojito ice coffee was A-Ok. Maybe it's because I didn't get the full creamy since my sister told me that one of them has same amount of calories as a big mac... Just think about having one big mac or TWO each day for those mint mojito iced coffee lovers... Just saying..
author: Angela K.

description:
This place is amazing.. Great coffee, free WiFi, large space, friendly staff, nice music, amazing location..

The only negative I can think of is that it takes for ever to get the coffee in busy hours..
author: Madhuri S.

description: Don't know how I haven't written a review of this place yet. Absolutely amazing, and totally affordable. One of the few chain coffee shops I've ever been to that still captures a local feel. The staff are amazing, the place is comfortable, and has free wifi. Most important, their coffee is amazing! I think I've tried ten different coffees here, ranging from light to dark roast and iced drinks, and I've yet to find one I didn't like. The fact that I don't have a favorite usual cup of coffee yet because they are all so good! Come here! Forget Starbucks!
author: Michael Z.
