description: Delicious Mocha Tesora! Light sweet is perfect! Baristas are super nice. Love that they ask you to try it first to tell them if you like it or not. :)
author: Jasmin I.

description:
A good place to camp with your laptop.

I usually come here on weekends. This place is crowded even on weekends, but there's enough tables and outlets that I pretty much always get a spot. Wifi is good, and there's also Skype wifi within range if you feel like paying for it. Parking is also easy around this area on weekends.

Lines to get drinks kind of comes in waves. Sometimes there's a line of 10 people, then 30 min later there's none. I wouldn't worry about it.

Pros (weekend experience):
 --- good location, next to civic center
 --- it's philz, so drinks are good
 --- parking easy on weekends
 --- good wifi & number of outlets

Cons: can't think of any! I've got a lot of work done at this place.
author: Elizabeth T.

description: My brother is in love w their mint mojitos and convinced me to try it. I've had Philz before, just never their specialty drinks. Anyway, I thought it was good, although way too heavy for me....I'll sub-in fat free milk next time and maybe give it another shot :)
author: Asmita J.

description:
Oh. My. Wow. What is happening to me right now as I drink this little piece of heaven in my cup? This place meets all of my requirements: bathroom, outlet, free wifi...and oh yes, non-Starbucks coffee!...LEGIT! AND it's 2 blocks from my place! HELLO! I love you! I decide to order the dark roast "ether" cuz I'm a scientist like that. They make it so easy to order...you can order it sweet, medium, creamy, etc. I ordered mine "sweet creamy". When the barista asked me how my coffee was...I just answered with a giant smile! This was IT! The hype is REAL! 

There's also a lot of people on first dates here...not that I'm eavesdropping...but it's super cute! Awww!  

They also have eco-friendly products like "Nika" water.

I think they have new hours too...they are open until 8pm. AND....they most definitely bump the old skool hip hop! Snoop Dogg....Dr. Dre... Yuupppp!! The music is so awesome, I had to write down the current playlist, I mean...I cannot get any work done because I just want to jam out! 

Bone Thugs: Crossroads
2Pac: Ain't Nothin' But a Gangsta Party
Outkast: AtLiens
Snoop Dogg: Gin and Juice
Dr. Dre: Nothin' But a G-Thang

Yes!
author: Leena B.

description: I agree.... WHYYYYYYY don't we have a Philz in LA?!? The iced mint mojito was delicious! They put mint leaves + coffee + crack + more mint leaves and frothy milk. I went on a wonderful adventure and back with my first sip... ;) I have nothing more to add other than.. I am so jelly there are none in LA!!!
author: Christy F.

description:
Damn I love the coffee at Philz but what is up with the attitude on the staff? I keep getting consistently grumpy, surly and unfriendly staff. The drinks are so good though that I can't stop coming back and simply have to put up with the miserablists behind the counter.

5 stars for coffee
0 stars for service
author: Mike R.

description: 4 bucks for a mocha I ended up tossing.  It was about a half inch of syrup at the bottom, despite requesting less syrup, and burnt coffee on top.  I also got a cream cheese Danish.  It was dry and stale as paper with a tiny, quarter sized cream cheese filling.  I'm amazed at the 5 stars of this place!  The staff was pretty nice at least.
author: Chelsea D.

description: Philz is my favorite way to start the day, so naturally when I leave town, I always pick up a bag of beans for the road. On the morning of departure for a recent trip, I was in such a rush to get home and finish packing that I bought a pound and then left Philz before they finished grinding them! Upon realizing my mistake I was really bummed. When I got back in town, I told my sob story to Sabrina who was totally understanding, and made my day with a new bag of coffee. Thank you so much Sabrina- you rock!
author: Genevieve D.

description:
It'z Philz... So of course the coffee is stellar.

As a frequent flyer of many of the Philz around SF, I must say that this one is particularly on point. There have been occasional hiccups during morning rushes, but the staff is more than accommodating to right any wrongs.

Also, their clever ploy has worked...
Some mornings I will get a bagel to tandem my coffee. I am quite fond of a simple smear of cream cheese on my bagel and would order it as such. However, on two separate visits, my cream cheese bagel was replaced with a Philz Bagel (cream cheese, olive oil, tomato, cucumber), I enjoy all of those things so I refused to force the staff to remake it. Now, I can't imagine ever going back to boring old plain cream cheese... So good!
author: Jesse B.

description:
Location: Conveniently located near the Civic Center Muni/Bart stop means you can grab coffee before or after you hit up the SF library or Asian Art Museum. Parking is better than the King st. location.

Coffee: 2 words: Mint Mojito. Made just as well as the other locations.

The bonus about this location is that it is large and offers outlets for laptops. Great place to catch up with a friend or get some studying done!
author: Emily C.

description:
I LOVE this Philz. Of course, Philz coffee is great, but this particular location is the BEST. The baristas/staff are super nice... Not pretentious... Patient and super helpful if I want something different & not sure. (The first time I asked for 1/2 decaf, they were cool in helping find something I would like.)

I've been to other Philz & thought people there were standoffish, so I really appreciate how friendly they are here.

(If you're new to Philz.... take your time. Ask the barista for suggestions. DON'T get the hot chocolate (yuck!). Personally, I think they make their tea too strong by default, but I asked them to adjust it and it was perfect! If you really don't know what you want and like something a bit sweet & creamy - get an Iced Mint Mojito. I suggestion drinking with the lid on to help filter some of the chunks of mint leaves, but YUM!)

The neighborhood has character. Only once have I seen a panhandler enter Philz & saw an employee quickly approach as ask her to leave. 

It also seems to be getting BUSIER - especially weekday mornings during coffee break time. :)
author: lynn t.

description: Such a quirky, cozy environment. Got an herbal mint tea. Friendly staff. Great stop on a cold, rainy day!
author: Valerie F.

description: Easily the best coffee in the Bay Area! Every location has friendly, fun staff who make an amazing cup of coffee. Is there a wait, of course, but that just means you're not the only one wanting a cup of awesomeness that day. Chill out, wait in line, and get your coffee euphoria on with everyone else. If you want a shorter wait with a mediocre cup of coffee, then attend a Starbucks with the other corporate lemmings!
author: Bradley V.

description:
OMG how did I not know about this place ?! No I just stumbled across it while in the area while desperate for caffeine, and who knew?? I have no idea what those flavors are on the board. Just pick one, any one! It will be good no matter what you choose. I can attest.

So delish. And so personable. Baristas who seem like they enjoy what they're doing? Whaa? You say the prices are high? The price of gourmet Turkish coffee is equivalent to your grande caramel mochas at the 'other' joint. Yet yours is loaded with fat and sugar. This is coffee simply at its best. 

Oh, and PLEASE open a location in Oakland!!
author: Christian J.

description: I found this place on Yelp and stopped by for a cup of coffee. I really liked the inside of the shop, clean but busy with some nice industrial decorations. I informed the barista Margret that I was new to ordering coffee and she was really helpful in suggesting what kind of brew would be best for me. In the end I decided to go with the "Sooo Good," light roast blend with two sweeteners and almond milk. A small cup of the "Sooo Good," blend cost 3$ I think. For me the experience as a whole was very good; pleasant and friendly barista's, and very delicious coffee. Just be sure to be patient when waiting for your coffee, it gets crowded VERY fast 8-9am on a weekday.
author: Brigette U.

description: Mint Mojito Iced Coffee is amazing.  Every cup is a pour over.  Breakfast options were good as well.  5 stars for excellent coffee, ambiance, and that damn mint Mojito iced.
author: Joshua K.

description: I am a wedding/event planner, and my client contracted the truck for her wedding. They were absolutely a dream to work with! Many vendors will either charge the client or downright refuse to come to Sonoma for a site visit for a wedding, but Philz actually reached out to schedule a site tour and was so patient with us to find a time to meet. On site, they were the most professional, courteous, and accommodating vendors I've worked with in a while. If you are considering them for your event, DO IT!
author: Melanie K.

description:
been waiting for this baby to open up FOREVAAA

prime prime location for any hastings student or anyone who works in the federal buildings.  you will probably have to get over the fact that crackheads (seriously) might be throwing backpacks at each other and yelling at you outside, but inside, there's a lot of seating, outlets, wifi, andddd breathing room.
author: Jennifer L.

description: This philz is huge compared to my usual location in berk.  I tried the tantalizing Turkish and a sweet treat to sneak into the play. Yum yum yum.
author: Virgo M.

description: The Iced Mint Mojito Coffee was worth the walk and wait. It had a good zing to it and made for a nice stroll around the nearby areas of San Francisco.
author: George D.

description: Have become a big fan... and this location is great because of the shot lines. Also commend Philz for putting such a nice shop in this transitional area.
author: Frank C.

description:
I heard about this place when visiting my Sausalito Philz (where I work). 

The place is very large and as is typical of Philz, the coffee is amazing.

Very nice staff that is very helpful and consultative in your coffee experience. I like to ask them for a recommendation and they always have a good idea of what to try next.

The area is not the best in town, but it has never detracted from my positive experience here
author: Eric G.

description:
This is my favorite coffee shop in the city. This particular Philz always has quick friendly service, great recommendations if you're looking for a new blend, and a place to sit if you're staying. 

If you walk in and there is a long line, fear not! The staff is friendly and quick. They acknowledge you and let you know they will be with you shortly. My usually order is a philtered should with soy. The baristas always get the perfect amount of cream to coffee ratio. A great place to get a quick breakfast, meet a friend for coffee, or get some work done.
author: Stephanie A.

description: Sadly Philz at Golden Gate has become part homeless shelter. Street people sit there half the day, even sleeping on the couches. Beggars come and go, harassing people in line, or just wandering around soliciting change. Staff is indifferent.
author: peter V.

description: I ordered a large ecstatic iced coffee and was very please with their medium and light coffee. The use of brown sugar didn't make it sweet but also tasted great with not a single feeling of bitterness. Their chocolate covered doughnut was pretty light also and filling. Coming from NY, it's a different change from the many venues that offer awesome coffee! Btw, they have comfortable seating and free wifi.
author: Elmar E.

description:
I'm having a ginger snap iced coffee here right now and it is ERMAZING. A lot less sweet and a lot more nuanced than I'd expected, this isn't Starbucks style mask-the-coffee-with-sugar drinks, they've really thought up some clever recipes. 

It's a really spacious and friendly place, and the service is fantastic: they were quick to get my order through but also keen to hear if it was right for me.

I'd definitely come here again.
author: Matt C.

description:
DRINK:
everyone knows the coffees here are tasty and strong and the special drink is the mint mojito ;) And the pastries are usually good, as I've gotten the quiches heated up before. And if for some reason you are abstaining from caffeine at the most popular coffee place, then there are also healthful Odwalla smoothies mmm!

SERVICE:
Philz workers always nice


ATMOSPHERE:
This is my favorite Philz out of all of them. Most cafe lounge feel, clean open, spacious... The only thing is, it's in the middle of the ghetto Tenderloin.
author: Angela L.

description:
Great coffee and great service! Lots of space too.

I had a small mint mojito iced coffee-$4.
author: Christina F.

description: My buddy got me a Mojito Iced Coffee from here. I wasn't sold on the idea but it turned out to be one of the best drinks I've ever had.
author: Russ M.

description:
I swear. Philz is my happy place. I wish I lived in the city just so I could drink this stuff every day. I love that all the baristas have an extensive knowledge of the menu and are all so friendly. 

This was my first time at this Philz and it was just as amazing as the first time I went, I had dalton, the barista, and he was able to fine tune my coffee to perfection. Engaging and thoughtful makes happy customers. 

I am beyond impressed and pleased with the service and quality of coffee here. 
If you're a coffee lover and you don't make it out to a Philz you're missing out!
author: Sam L.

description:
The best coffee I've ever had. My two favorites are the medium roast tesora with cream and sugar and an iced mint mojito whenever I have a sweet tooth. I can't get enough of this place.

I try to bring my friends here every time they come visit me. They see all my Instagram and Facebook posts, but they don't realize how amazing the flavor is until they've had it themselves.

If you haven't tried it yet, you are missing out on life. Grab a cup and live life a little!
author: Mimi V.

description:
Definitely my favorite Philz.  Nice spacious location with plenty of seating.  The staff are all friendly and almost all of them know my order by heart.

It's a great way to start my morning!
author: Scott F.

description:
I finally had Philz the other night.

Is a sentence i never believe I woud say, because I should've had Philz about iono 10 years ago! For being such a coffee slut, I'm ashamed that I've waited this long to put my lips on that brown signature cup. 

It was 30 degrees in SF and I had their Gingerbread Iced Coffee. Why? Because I'm a G and I can do whatever the hell I want. Usually with iced coffee, the coffee tastes can get easily diluted by the melting ice; but no, not with this cup of sexy cold-blooded tall cup of espresso. The aroma and flavor was explosive a la Chronic 2001. RIP Nate Dogg. Hits you right away then slowly introduced her friends like cinnamon, all-spice, nutmeg, and so on. Just enough to make the party rocking all night or until there's no more delicious coffee left. 

The service was wonderful too. Well...besides the whole thing where...the baristas told me go to the cash register and so and so will ring me up. Walks there...looks around...5 minutes later still not a soul. I then decided to go check on my friends and of course right when i do, she/he shows up! Then as I walk back to the cash register I got the biggest attitude of... why-did-you-take-so-long-to-pay-for-your-coffee. Excluding that, I thoroughly enjoyed Philz and will come back anytime!
author: Tung T.

description: Five stars just for opening a Philz in the Tenderloin/Civic Center area.
author: Morris R.

description: Damn that was good coffee! $4 though for a large...but so good. And on the way to work...it'll be a weekly "treat" for me to look forward to!
author: Monica S.

description:
I really dislike Philz coffee. When I lived in the Mission, I went to the one on 24th and Folsom. I was charged nearly 4 dollars for a cup of coffee and it took a year and a day to prepare. I stopped going in there and went elsewhere for my coffee. So, I had not been into Philz for years until recently. 

Last week, a friend who works downtown wanted to meet up for coffee and told me "There's a Philz across the street." I began to narrow my eyes, but since this was across from her office and convenient for her, I said "Okay." So I go in to meet my friend. While we were there, lots of cops and firemen came through. So if you want to hit on a cop or fireman, this is probably a good place to hang out.

I get in line to order my coffee and there are two people behind me also waiting. While I'm standing there waiting, where the girl at the counter can clearly see me and the others behind me, the girl has a conversation with a fireman. Seriously. I don't mean she was talking about what coffee he wanted--she was just chatting away with him, while other people waited. I really couldn't believe it--who does this? She just went on and on and on. Finally, she stopped talking and I was able to place my order. 

The woman wanted to know which coffee I wanted. "Which one has the most caffeine?" I asked. I ordered that one. $3 for a small coffee and $3.25 for tea for my friend. THREE DOLLARS. FOR A SMALL CUP OF COFFEE. Three dollars and change for a cup of tea. The place near my house gives me a medium cup for $1.65 and they are really nice people to boot. 

So I went back to my friend  and waited. And waited. And lo, when we had waited for many eons, someone served up the tea and coffee. I picked it up and went to the cash register and waited to pay. There was no one there at the cash register, so I just stood there like an idiot. Eventually I figured I'd pay later and took the coffee and tea over to my table. My friend and I talked for more than an hour. 

When it was time for me to go, I went over to the cash register (where there was still no one) and waited for someone to show up. Finally, I thought "This is ridiculous" and left. 

So, to sum up: Philz is overpriced and pretentious. But if you have time to kill and don't care how much something costs, you should go here. You may meet a handsome policeman or fireman as well.
author: Sue C.

description: Absolutely love the mint mojito. I probably could drink it every day if I didn't live 400 miles away. Once upon a time, I was able to try it with milk, but now I have to get almond milk due to certain digestive issues (sadness). Luckily, it tastes better that way, in my opinion. I love my sweets, but I always request my drink a little less sweet than they normally make it- which actually brings out the minty flavor. I particularly like this one shop because there is never a line. The four times I have been there in recent past, there wasn't a single person ordering ahead of me. It's not that the shop is dead. They're just so efficient. The fact that I don't have to even wait to get my perfectly crafted cold mint mojito definitely makes this Philz worth going to... I haven't checked out the LA Philz yet... Mostly because I imagine a line out the door while your car is being ticketed then towed. Maybe I'll risk it one day when the craving gets to be too much. I'm definitely making myself crave it now. Shoot.
author: Mi K.

description: Get the mint mojito iced or the mocha tesora hot. This location has tons of seating and the lines are usually a little shorter than Van Ness.
author: Calvin W.

description:
Wow! I had my first Philz coffee here and won't be able to enjoy any other kind again (disclaimer: I haven't tried Blue Bottle yet). I never thought I could be a coffee snob until I had my "usual" iced coffee here. I've been getting the ecstatic iced coffee with medium cream and sugar for a few weeks and am addicted. 

The only thing I'll miss about the Tenderloin after graduating from UC Hastings is Philz.
author: Annie C.

description:
Philz has great coffee. The employees at this location seem to be friendlier than at other locations (not that the other employees aren't friendly). 

This location is clean and very fast in the afternoon (my little secret spot because it's faster than other coffee houses in the afternoon). 

My only complain is that they are usually cleaned out of snacks by the time I go in the afternoon.
author: Michael E.

description:
How can anyone not LOVE Philz. No matter what location - the staff is always friendly, happy and helpful. 

And the Mint Mojito coffee is TO DIE FOR! Seriously ;) 

I always hear about how good the other coffees are, but I have found it hard to order anything else because the mint mojito is just that good. Maybe someday I will branch out - but I don't expect it to be anytime soon. I may just have to order two coffees the next time I visit. 

If I lived or worked closer to a Philz I would definitely be there multiple times a week.
author: Shannon H.

description: One of the best coffee places in the Bay area. The mint mojito ice coffee was to die for. Right amount of sweetness, it was just great. The staffs were extremely friendly and energetic, great atmosphere here. There were plenty of power plug-ins for your phones or computers if you wish. Great place!
author: Zisele N.

description: Love this place.  What's not to like?  Friendly service. Cool grooves. Amazing coffee.
author: Neal W.

description: Philz truly is the best coffee I've ever had.  My absolute favorite is Philtered soul and Tesoro.  Ask for it "Philz way" I promise, you won't be disappointed.
author: Mike A.

description:
Coolest baristas... seriously, I never had so much respect for them until I went here.

These guys have it together!  Even if you dont like coffee, its worth a trip here just to see them in action.  The place seems to always be packed!
author: Brent K.

description:
I look for 3 things in a coffee shop:
- good coffee
- free wifi
- outlets 

This place is spot on. Ample seating. Wide space so you don't feel cramped. 

Just strap on your head phones, sip some coffee, and get some work done.
author: Eunice K.

description: Philz coffee was my regular go to places . Me and my friend go there at least three times a week. But today something unusual happened and I was embarrassed for being nice to cashier girl named STEPH. I complimented her plaid shirt , got my coffee and was chatting with my friend about important stuff. The coffee here is super good, and always fresh. As we were talking suddenly the lady and her manager comes in by asks us to leave the place coz Cashier didn't like my compliment and she felt uncomfortable.  Such a low self esteem girl working in such a great coffee place. The manager should have handled the situation professionally but instead she harassed us in front of all customers. Shame that such a great coffee place has shitty manager. We had no choice but leave the cafe with our coffee in out hands. Never going that store.
author: Krishna L.

description:
Mocha Tesoro with almond milk ... I'd drink this all day if it didn't guarantee my fate of cardiac arrest.  

Ginger snap iced coffee .... It's like liquid gingerbread men. And not too sweet . 

This is definety the best coffee shop I've ever been to. 

I think I'm coming back tomorrow so ill try more and add it to my review .
author: Kate M.

description:
Hands down the best coffee in the city. I like how they list the flavors for each of their coffees, and the baristas know how to make it taste perfect (they'll do the sugar and milk for you). Way better than Blue Bottle and SightGlass. 

Best drink: Philtered Soul
Taste: 5/5 
Ambiance: Coffeehouse
Price: 3-4/person 
Service: Great, and they give you free samples sometimes
author: Kevi L.

description: Creative iced and hot coffee options won me over. But what's with the sizes?! An iced drink easily needs to be in a larger cup - half of its ice! With the prices standardized its at least not going to be a surprise at the cash register.
author: Regina D.

description: To be frank they have the best coffee selection on the go in SF.  Great rich tasting coffee.  Very nice atmosphere and the employees are friendly.  Based on their coffee pricing ($4 & up per cup) they target the yuppies, wealthy, and college crowd who are fairly well off. Me and my coworkers go there daily and are always satisfied. I gave it four stars only because they don't offer a cup under $4 for those who can't afford such daily treats.
author: Murray D.

description:
So I drink a lot of coffee. I am I'm that class of person who probably deserves an intervention ("I had no idea how my additions were damaging my relationships..." [insert crocodile tears here]). So today when a friend suggested that I have a coffee at Philz while I waited for her, I had zero expectations since most coffee is well within one standard deviation of the mean; not too bad and not too good. 

Suffice to say, I was more than pleasantly surprised. I chose a small "New Manhattan."  It was extremely flavorful, and served at a good temperature: cool enough to enjoy immediately but hot enough to last and make you savor the taste, lest you burn your tongue."

The place was packed, so I asked a gent if I could share his table, and he gladly obliged. 

As a side note, a bunch of police officers showed up for some tasty beverages. I always see this as an important data point since they are in that class of professional that, due to the nature of the job, need to dine out often. Therefore, they are pretty good at identifying places that do not provide value for the money. Plus the were a genial lot, and I rarely say that about "The Man."

I only wish they had more baked goods and whatnot. I was there late in the day, so I'll give them the benefit of the doubt, but a piece of cake would have made the perfect companion to the delicious brew. Just sayin'.
author: Stephen G.

description:
I've been here several times and each time was a disappointment. My mocha tesora was so watery, it tasted like chocolate sludge water. It didn't taste remotely like coffee! The mint mojito iced coffee was slightly better, very minty and great for hot weather. It's great that you can customize your drink and the customer service is very good, but I think I prefer Blue Bottle or Curbside Coffee over Philz. I also think that if you're paying $4 for a coffee drink, you should use something better than Berkeley Farms...

Drink disappointments aside, this is a cute space right on the corner of Larkin and Golden Gate and conveniently located for state workers, law students, and attorneys making appearances at any of the nearby courthouses.
author: Bella L.

description: Love it but wish Philz would use compostable coffee lids. Please be a leader in this!
author: Lauren S.

description: Yum!  Had to endure a walk through the TL to reach this location from Union Square.  But as soon as I walked inside, I immediately felt warm and welcome.  I went on a Sunday morning around 11am and it wasn't that crowded.  You can't go wrong with their iced mint mojito coffee.  It's so refreshing with the perfect amount of sweetness and creaminess.  I also got a chocolate chip cookie.  It was delicious.  It made the walk back to Union Square a bit more bearable.
author: Eunice J.

description:
Sound the alarm.

Philz has opened in the Tenderloin.

He brought with him the unique and smooth Greater Alarm blend with hints of nuts, berries and pineapple.

He also hired a staff that is energetic, outgoing and committed to making sure every cup exceeds expectations.

He made sure it all happens in a space that feels welcoming, open and unafraid to become a part of the neighborhood.

Philz should be welcomed with open arms.
author: Jason B.

description:
What's the best kept coffee secret in Sausalito?   It's Philz on.....................?  street.  Real coffee lovers will find it...........    I shouldn't even be yelping because better to keep amateur coffee drinkers away...........but had two good cups of "Jacob's Wundarbar"...chocolate and coffee in one drink!  Studied for an hour while sipping great java..   Service always great, Pat the barrista there this afternoon.   Best coffee and it's real coffee, not hot milk and bland beans pumped full of diabetes causing white refined sugar like the other chains who shall go unnamed like the villain in the Potter movies!   


Great music too!
author: Kevin B.

description: The coffee is good, the staff very friendly. The problem I have with Philz is the temperature of the coffee. It's warm to tepid. Now, I don't want my coffee to be burning hot, but come on, a little warmer would be nice. I always get drip and it was near cool when I first tasted it. So strange.
author: Martha H.

description: Good coffee as usual.  A little small to find room to sit, but the main issue I had was the lack of power outlets to charge my phone.
author: Jim T.

description:
Pardon my language. 

I FUCKING love this place. For the longest time I was a loyal Peetsnik then transitioned over to SightGlass. Not any more. Philz Coffee is the best cup of coffee I have ever had.
author: Paul A.

description:
Last couple of years I've heard Philz Coffee was excellent, but really never paid it too much heed.  I won't lie I fell for the Blue Bottle, Four Barrel, Sightglass and other hipster coffee spots of San Francisco. I associated Philz with Union Square style coffee like Peet's and Coffee Bean. But as I am soon leaving this city I decided I owed it to myself as a lover of coffee to give it a try. I have been each morning since...

They are friendly, they have options, they are quick, they take card, what else more do I need to say. Oh, and the coffee is good! It is possible that Blue Bottle edges Philz a tad, maybe, but it sure as hell is not worth waiting for when Philz is available. Its my favorite coffee spot in the city. Gonna miss it when I leave this coffee loving city.
author: Adam W.

description:
Tired from walking around the city all day?

Want to grab something refreshing?

Don't mind walking past a bunch of drug addicts?

Ok well, come here and get their mint mojito coffee. I made the trek here just for that. Yep, it's that good.
author: Peter Y.

description:
Amazing coffee. I ordered an iced Silken Splendor and it was absolutely delicious, quite possibly the best iced coffee I've ever had. I've had a lot of hyped up gourmet coffee before, but this actually delivered. 
Ambiance is relaxed and spacious, and the staff was very friendly and helpful. Can't wait to keep coming to this place.
author: Clara H.

description:
Two words: Code 33.

Gird your loins for it is near Civic Center.
If you manage to brave the battle that skirts the T-Loin and Downtown area...
Drop in, grab a seat and enjoy a Mint Mojito or one of their Chai options.

Plug in your laptop and stay a while.
The coffee is superb.
author: Faye V.

description: You know you live in San Francisco when half your facebook newsfeed are people checking in to Philz for their wifi access. Gotta admit, if you like Turkish coffee, Philz is the best in the city. I only knock the star off because I'm not a huge fan of Turkish coffee and sometimes the beans get in your coffee. Order the mint mojito, definitely the best item on the menu.
author: Cody M.

description: I'd kill to have this at my university. They'd put every coffeehouse out of business and I'd go every day, no nonsense. The blends are various and delicious. The price is really reasonable for what they offer and I love the environment, it's everything I'm looking for in a place to drink great coffee regularly
author: Ruchit K.

description: Yikes, stay away! They have this huge chalkboard with writing on it and instead of reading for 10 minutes I asked the lady if they had a mocha. Seemed like a reasonable question considering they are a coffeeshop and their menu has 5000 words of text on it. After a sigh and a snobby reply discussing how they only have normal coffee there I asked for a coffee. Apparently that too is an inappropriate request. In short, poor service, inefficient ordering system, lots of pretentious douchebags, thanks but no thanks.
author: Nick P.

description:
New Manhattan medium sweet with sugar and cream. It was perfect and not bitter! Caffeine kept me going for 8+ hours. 

This location is a couple blocks away from Van Ness location, and it is way roomier and less crowded! 5 stars in my book. Oh, and $3 coffee? Unheard of.
author: Jeanne C.

description: I actually don't drink coffee (gasp!) but the Philz Chai is soooo yummy. I ask for it with honey instead of sugar, otherwise the caffeine and sugar combo has me bouncing off the walls. I come here a few times a week and I just truly appreciate the service so much, which I've heard is the most courteous at this location! Everyone is such a sweet heart. Thanks Philzsters!
author: nikki l.

description: Did not know this location exists until I walked by the neighbourhood.  This location is very spacious and plenty of seatings.  Granted that it is a Philz, but after three tries; the Ether is still not as good as the Berry location.
author: Chi T.

description:
Overpriced? Yes
The Mint Mojito iced coffee? So worth it ( about once a month of course).
author: Hillary H.

description: Great tasting coffee. I had the one with hints of chocolate, figured I might as well trying something new while I was in a new store, and it was delicious.  They put the cream and sugar in themselves, which was kind of strange but worked out well.  Not expensive either, I'll definitely be back.
author: Scott N.

description:
Best coffee I have ever had, even Coffee Bean. Will be going out of my way to go to this place now....
Philz is awesome...
author: Jim B.

description: Delicious! If it's your first time, get the iced mint mojito.  Must have whenever you're in the bay!
author: Mari Dani B.

description: I'm a bonafide chai tea whore and this chai tea is the best chai I've ever had.  They make it from scratch, it's not a syrupy concoction like Sbux.  You can custom order it to be mildly sweet, medium sweet or super sweet.  Recommend the mildly sweet version... It's slightly creamy but not overpowering... BOMB!!!
author: Danielle S.

description: This is one coffee chain (local) I wouldn't avoid. Great blends, great Batistas.  I come here all the time. Definitely the best coffee near the civic center area.
author: Anandh V.

description: Friendly staff, good amount and a variety of seating, tasty scones and, most importantly, the first coffee-strength coffee I've had in this city! Seriously, every other place seems to water down their stuff, but this was quite good!
author: David J.

description: 2 visits so far - it's on the way to my Wednesday night power game. As my other reviews attest, I am an extreme Philz Phan. Coffee that tastes the way that you would explain that coffee tastes to someone that never tasted coffee. Great place - comfortable service. If this place was near my house, I would rarely leave.
author: Nick L.

description:
First time to Philipz. Wanted to knock off a star off because of the surrounding area, clean yourself up San Francisco. 

Coffee was great, but the highlight of my trip was the cinnamon bun. Pillsbury would be jealous.
author: John E.

description: Some of the best coffee I have ever had in my life. I went there everyday while in San Francisco and I wish so badly I had this place near my hometown. One day I even got 2 cups to go because I knew I wouldn't be satisfied with just 1. I love Philz. With all my heart and soul.
author: Rebekah S.

description: Love love LOVE the mint mojito iced coffee!  I have never had a bad thing here so pretty much pick what sounds good to your taste buds.  Pastries are also delicious and fresh.  I particularly like the ginger scone, not super hard like a lot of places.
author: Trenicia W.

description: Only one style of coffee and takes FOREVER. Don't come here if you're in a rush or want anything other than a pour over coffee.
author: Ben S.

description: Mint mojito is special but so are many of their brews. The apricot bar is dope. The cold brew is intense and you should order it if you need a pick me up
author: Thomas B.

description: This location is amazing!!! Way better than the Vanness one close by. Amazing baristas, staff and best of all.... excellent vibes here! And very spacious!
author: Anonymous ?.

description: Had hot chocolate. It tasted Like Swiss miss. I didn't even like Swiss miss when I was kid...
author: ashley q.

description: Today was my first time checking this location out. The space was very spacious with plenty of tables to hang or do work. definitely a hipster joint (in a good cozy kinda of way :) I ordered the mint mojito which is my go to! And absolute favorite. I asked for less sweetness and the barista did a fab job!!
author: Sandra W.

description: I wish Philz would open a location in the Financial District! I have random cravings for the mint mojito coffee, but there are no locations within walking distance. They also need more locations in the East Bay for non-work days. I like this location because it's usually not overcrowded, is roomy, and the baristas are usually quick and friendly. I always get the mint mojito because it's just so yummy. I have to get the larger size because the smaller one just disappears too quickly. When I want a hot drink, I'll turn to the Tesora.
author: Becky C.

description: Great on weekends bc no crazy line like the one on berry street.
author: Kris O.

description: The mint mojito is something else. I am no coffee expert, but as a mint-anything lover, the coffee was spiritual. Must get again when I am in SF. Please open one in socal.
author: SJ Y.

description: The best coffee ever.  Sometimes ordering at this store is kind of confusing but it is OK because it is the best coffee ever.
author: Joseph M.

description: This Philz is not as great as some of the others. Usually prefer Van Ness location in SF or the SJSU location if I'm in the South Bay. The turn around was slow and the flavor of the coffee was off. Will stick to my favorite ones.
author: Mike T.

description: My iced coffee was truly delicious!  Their order/pay/pick up/coffee condiments process is chaotic, but doesn't take away from the good coffee. Price is high at $4, which is why this was a treat and not an every-day beverage.
author: Laura A.

description: I had the mint mohito and I couldn't get enough of it. I had it again the following day and the day after. It's too good. I recommend everyone to try it at least once and you will become a fan!
author: Prateek M.

description: Great coffee. Parking is brutal in the morning. Understaffed in early AM, long waits.
author: Greg C.

description: good coffee in the tenderloin strong hot coffee part of the genertifcation of mid market
author: Leigh G.

description: a rather unique twist on coffee with some really refreshing creative flavors!  A must go when I am in the bay area.  mint mojito is still my favorite!
author: John B.

description: Great coffee, great service... Try the Turkish with vanilla soy and honey instead of cream and sugar. They use really heavy cream so I opt for the soy since I drink a few cups a week. The philz bagel is also great.
author: Carlos V.

description: Delicious tesora coffee blend, lightly sweetened with soy. The staff were all very friendly and helpful in giving recommendations. Nice seating and ambiance.
author: Danielle M.

description: I love Philz coffee but don't go because of how rude the baristas usually are to me (I'm talking to you 18th/Castro and Van Ness locations) but today I was treated with respect and friendliness by my barista, he made a bomb ass coffee drink for me and totally made my shitty day MUCH better!!! Thanks Golden Gate location barista! Hopefully I'll catch his name the next time I go in, which should be sooner than later!
author: Bertamus R.

description: choice of regular soy or vanilla soy. they carry Starter Bakery's kouign amanns. get one (traditional one) warmed up and enjoy.
author: Susy C.

description: Hands down... BEST COFFEE SPOT... PERIOD!!!  Great customer service and even better coffee.  I wish I could clone this place and it's workers and bring it closer to my house.  Thank goodness they opened up right across the street from work.  I'm an addict and I'm okay with it!
author: Gabriela R.

description: Convenient location for people working in/near Civic Center station.  Coffee is great, and sometime the wait isn't that long.
author: Jer M.

description: IN LOVE with the Tesora Coffee. Seven years in the making and the first blend to ever be created, the Tesora is a treasure that consists of the most valuable and complex jewels of coffee. If it is your first time visiting Philz coffee, I  recommend  the Tesora blend. The location is great, bathrooms are clean and the food and coffee is amazing. Good service and selection! Will be trading starbucks for Philz!
author: Jess C.

description: Came here because of all the great reviews and I had to have the iced coffee mint mojito. Delicious and refreshing! Two thumbs up! Also, just down the street from Brenda's so it was a great way to kill some time.
author: Kim G.

description: I always love Philz. The coffee great, and the atmosphere is nice.
author: Spencer R.

description: I finally visited this newest Philz Coffee location and like it very much.  It seems to be the most spacious one with the most seating (unfortunately I have yet to go to any location at a time when I can stay and relax to a cup).  The interior is bright and cheerful in my opinion.  Also, as usual, great coffee selections.
author: H K.

description: Philz coffee, you have such a way of bettering customers, baristas and everyone's day, simply by being you. I don't know of another coffee shop that could even attempt to do what you do. You're the full package: great coffee, amazing environment, and wonderful people. Thank you for getting me through some rough days and thank you to my awesome Golden Gate crew for being like family to me!
author: Mads M.

description: Yeah it's good coffee. I won't deny it. And I love that the baristas actually take the time to chat with you as you're deciding. But when it comes to the actual coffee I feel like the competition at Sightglass or Ritual is pretty steep and continues to up their game. May have once been the top of my list but as my coffee snobbery increases I tend to go elsewhere.
author: Dan F.

description: Philz to rule the world, and this time located in the catchy corner spot in the Tenderloin, *cough*, I mean Civic Center. The Philtered Soul was the same great flava-drink as I get at the Berry and/or Van Ness location. FIve-stars of YAY for making bold coffee drinks in the T'Loin.
author: Derek N.

description: Love the Philz! Great staff, free wifi and mostly great playlists to get you going if good music and coffee is your thing that is. Great location at the crossroads in the city. Oh yeah, armed federal agents and cops hang out here too! What's not to love about that!?
author: Keef Y.

description: great coffee, good staff...philz coffee has a unique taste big plus on the j.blue mountain one of the best in the city..I've had peet's and starbucks reserve j. blue mountain but philz is worth every penny....
author: jonathan h.

description: The foam matches the taste so well. I'm on rich and creamy coffee cloud!
author: Yuki A.

description: Great coffee, convenient location (right near my school and the courts), and super cute and spacious interior. The reason I didn't give it 5 stars is the music: why are we listening to gangster rap music in a coffee shop? I do realize we are in the Tenderloin, but still. Something a little more "Colbie Callet"ish would be much appreciated. Other than the music, great place. For now I'll just keep listening to my Spotify on their free wi-fi.
author: lisa l.

description:
Large corner store front; can't miss it.

Might be confusing when you place your order for the barrister don't acknowledge you so you might just be standing there wondering what the heck to do.

Their highly raved mojito coffee is not as strong as you think initially until the day goes by and you're like why the heck is my head throbbing?

Would I pay another $4.50 for an iced mojito coffee? Probably not. Sadly, the name just sounds better than what's produced.
author: Keiko C.

description: Came here for the first time last month while visiting San Francisco and I absolutely loved it!!! The service, the coffee, the ambience, the seating...I loved it all. I had the mocha coffee with a mexican chocolate biscotti (it was a little spicy-yummy). Can't wait to make it back to San Francisco so I can have some Philz Coffee.
author: Brenda L.

description:
MINT MOJITO ICED COFFEE... so delicious!

I wish they had a Philz in Los Angles. People would go ape sh*t over this place. The baristas were so nice and accommodating. They continuously apologized for the wait and thanked the customers for being so patient. I didn't mind waiting for my coffee because I knew it was fresh and I understand drip coffee takes time. They were also nice enough to adjust the sweetness of my drink! I definitely want to come back here and try something else on the menu but the mint mojito was so good I might be tempted to just get it again.
author: Kristine B.

description: The first Philz I've ever been to...only took me long enough. I have been here two or three times now and I wish there was one closer to me! The Mint Mojito Iced Coffee is really as good as everyone says it is. I took my boyfriend's parents here and they loved it so much I bought them two bags of coffee for them for Christmas. The place itself has always been well-kept whenever I've dropped in. It's also spacious and a great place to just hang out or study. I can't really say more than what's been said already. Just writing this review is making me crave a cup right now!
author: Jenny C.

description: A cozy spot with great green tea with fresh mint leaved. Free WiFi with strong connection. Great spot to kill time when needed. The staff is also friendly and know their stuff when it comes to coffee and tea.
author: Julie S.

description: This Philz is located so close to my school and has become one of my study spots.  It's spacious and has plenty of outlets.  Its baristas are super friendly, always with big smiles on their faces.  Coffee is amazing and you can buy Pepple's vegan donuts here!  Need I say more?  Come and check it out for yourself.  ;-)
author: Henna C.

description: I still wish Philz opened a few more blocks closer to my work...I'd come here everyday if I could to get my caffeine high, but it is 2 blocks less for me to walk to compared to the Van Ness and Eddy street location.  This place is HUGE!!! There is so much open space...even behind the bar, they set up their gazillion buckets of coffee beans and have an area to sell their gear.   Came here to get my Mint Mojito....I should just buy 2 cups since I can never get enough of it.  The staff here are pretty cool as usual!
author: Lisa W.

description: This was my first visit to Philz. The concierge at my hotel said it was his favorite coffee in San Francisco but about a 25 minute walk from where I was staying in Union Square. Off I went with my map and a stern warning about the Tenderloin area. I'm not afraid of much but on my walk I encounter a man defecating on the sidewalk, a few guys nodding out up against a building (one with the needle still in his arm), and several let's say, "spirited" requests for a donation.... All I could think was this coffee better be amazing. It was.
author: Kate C.

description: Hands down my favorite Philz. Same great coffee as their other cafes, but the staff seems much friendlier and efficient than their other locations. Love it!
author: Ryan S.

description: My husband is a fan of Philz so when we saw the place, we had to go in! Place was full until closing time; an indication that it's a good place to hangout or get work done.  I love that they have decaf french roast. I kept asking my husband if it was decaf since they're coffee is pretty strong, otherwise I'd be awake for days!! One of the baristas, who made the coffee, was very friendly  but the cashier, not so much.
author: Lori L.

description: The best Philz in the city. Very spacious, lots of seating, great playlist going, friendly staffers, good airflow (some other locations are actually stuffy/hot). And the Mint Mojito Iced Coffee, wow... wish there was a San Diego location!
author: Ethan L.

description: I love Philz, wish there was one closer but I make it a habit of going to one whenever I'm nearby. I always get one of their ice coffees and buy a bag of beans for my office.
author: David C.

description:
The only thing different about this Philz is that it's three blocks closer to me compared to the one on Van Ness. And of course, since it's new, it's looks and smells clean (and I hope it stays that way!!). Plenty of room and seats. Very nice workers. Oh, and the most noticeable difference of all is that they play some hip hop jams ;) 

Coffee is the same =  a w e s o m e. Give your taste buds a break from Starbucks and come here :) 

What more can I say? It's a Philz!
author: Mila B.

description: Always 5 Stars for Philz no matter where I go. This location is spacious with an OK parking spots only on the weekends. Good Coffee as always without anything bad to say. I don't have a location preference, whatever on my way, I park and grab a cup. Very excited about the SSF location as its the closest to me.
author: Shadi K.

description: LOVE-LOVE-LOVE The Mocha Tesora! The place is very big & clean! very friendly staff.
author: Michele T.

description: If you visit San Francisco you definitely need to visit Philz! Did not discover this place until the last day of my visit and that made me sad. The menu has cool selections at a decent price. My barista was awesome and helped me with my drink. If I ever visit again I will be going to Philz for my coffee fix.
author: Steven T.

description: I love Philz.  This location is beautiful inside, I will definitely be back.
author: Christy L.

description: Good place. Very friendly. Has WiFi and power sockets, my new absolute essential in cafes now.
author: Dino C.

description:
Iced Mint Mojito -- Hands down the best mojito I ever had. Fresh as a fountain. A must have for people who visit our state.
The service is pretty good as well. They serve with a smile, the ambiance is perfect for sitting and working on your laptop specially with the free wi-fi. 
I love this place :)
author: Caroline G.

description: Now before I start on this path of what may appear to be total foolishness, I have to preclude what I am  about to say with some facts. Fact 1: There is something in Philz coffee that makes me smarter. I don't mean like I take a sip and I'm more alert and awake. I literally mean, I take a sip and I make Stephen Hawking look like Giligan from Giligans island. I used to drink Starbucks coffee and would have a stomach ache 5 minutes later. After taking a few sips of Philz, I'm probably the smartest person alive.  Fact 2: I think I know that the people working in the Philz coffee truck know that their coffee makes people smarter, but they don't know that I know that they know theres some weird coffee voodoo going on here. Is there a witch doctor sacrificing chickens and reading dice made out of bones sitting in the back of the truck invoking spirits into the coffee? The Philz staff all have this weird grin on their face. I don't need to know how you do it. Just know that I KNOW that what your doing is probably not legal in most countries. Fact 3: As I have been writing this, I have just thought of 3 ways how to raise a million dollars in about a week. I could tell all you pretty easilly but I'm sure you're not interested. My Mocha Tesora is cold now, but it's power is still running strong. I've found that if I drink a cup at around 9:30 AM, my mind starts to return to it's previous non-genius state at around 2pm. The flow chart I'm working on right now is goddamm amazing. I've never used Visio in my life. Final Fact: I dropped my chocolate chip  and walnut cookie yesterday waiting for my coffee yesterday. Philz coffee truck you lose 2 stars for that.
author: N C.

description: Philz doesn't need another review, but I love their coffee.  The staff at this location (Larkin and GG) is really nice and I always fee like a regular when I walk in.  This is one of my favorite places for a cup in SF.
author: Michael H.

description:
Now this is a coffee shop! My law school is obsessed with this coffee shop. They always give away free gift cards to here.

I finally came last week and was thrilled! It's spacious, clean and comfortable! I ordered the mint mojito coffee and got it sweet, creamy and minty-- iced. Delicious! Phil himself actually came up to our group and asked how we liked the coffee and how we were, and thanked us for coming in. New study and break spot for sure!
author: Mona Z.

description: I LOVE PHILZ. I'm a regular here and the coffee is always top notch (they always say, "make sure it's perfect!"), the music is always fun, the tables are nice and big and comfortable, and to staff treats its customers so well! I'm so sad that it took so long to finally get a PHILZ in the Civic Center area, but now that it is here, the neighborhood is slowly but surely improving!
author: Djamila D.

description: Love it love it love it!!! Even though alil bit packed, the coffee didn't disappoint me at all. Free WiFi , a lot of chairs and tables, can't ask for more.
author: Alice K.

description:
Philz Coffee is by far one of the best coffee places I've ever been to.  I have a sweet tooth and like to order a Jacob's Wonderbar or Philtered Soul with medium cream and sugar when I want hot coffee, or the mint mojito or ecstatic iced coffee when I want something colder.  If it's your first time, then ask the barista; the baristas know their coffee and are great at recommending drinks, and if they don't make it right, they're fast at fixing it.  Also, if you bring your own mug, you get a large coffee for the price of a small, which is $3 at this location.

Warning: Philz is great at keeping the hobos and crazies out of the store, but this store is not located in a very safe neighborhood so don't leave anything in your car and know your surroundings.
author: M. N.

description:
I just completely love this place. It seems to have just everything I expect out of a coffee shop. There is washroom, free WiFi and of course fantastic coffee. You can browse as much as you like and enjoy coffee and little snacks at your own pace. The staff is ever smiling and even helps you make your choice. The place is comfy, have enough chairs to let you sit down and actually enjoy coffee. Even though I had heard a lot about this place, this is my first visit and I am very impressed. 

Lot of young crowd hanging around. The selection of music is also good. Just not got enough of this place yet!
author: Kimberly F.

description: I think I may have had the best cup of coffee of my life this morning and it was called "it'z the best." Wow. Great location as well--spacious with lots of seating.
author: Hi T.

description: One of the things that made me decide to accept an internship at Civic Center. Philz is amazing
author: mikhael b.

description:
don't order hot chocolate!
it's made with way too much powdered chocolate and HOT WATER! 
then topped with a little cream to make it taste creamy. ( their description)
no mik! 
amazing!
who ever heard of hot chocolate without milk.
it was terrible!
author: lianne v.

description: This was my first time at Philz. I was a bit overwhelmed by their menu, so I went with the Mint Mojito and was not disappointed. The location itself is a good place to bring your laptop and get some work done. The only downside is that it's located in one of the sketchiest corners of the city. If you go there, don't walk down Hyde and Golden Gate but Larkin, feels a bit safer.
author: Lisa O.

description:
I love Philz, but the people at this new location are idiots. Every time, something has gone wrong, whether its running out of a certain coffee or bagel, or in this instance today, making my bagel and just leaving it on the counter for 10 min without telling me. A 'sorry about the confusion' would have been nice instead of the 'Its been ready for a while and we've been waiting for you' I got after their f-up.. jack asses.

Go to the one on Van Ness!
author: Casey A.

description: The coffee here is made by the cup. It's really delicious coffee, but, understandably, takes a little while to be made. Not the place to grab a cup on the go, but rather to sit and talk while you wait for your gourmet cup of coffee to be brewed. Staff is friendly and the place is always packed, so be prepared to stand. P.S. WiFi is FREE for customers.
author: Susan L.

description: this review only gets 2 points because of the big chunky curly black haired girl who served me. i ordered a large coffee loud and clear. while this girl was making everybodys coffee she was more focused on screwing around with her other employee than getting the drink out and correct. my issue is the attitude she has. i stood there waiting for my drink and i noticed she had put out a small coffee so i ignored it. then she starts putting out large coffees and no one shows up to take them. i kindly walk up and ask her if this was my drink and she say no and the small one is mine. I told her that i clearly ordered a large and had already paid for it. with attitude she rolls her eyes pours out her mistake and tell me take this one then. i was in a rush so i took it and was not willing to wait for this girl to remake my drink. if you cant listen properly you might want to get your ears checked. plus the drink tasted like crap. thanks alot.
author: Art N.

description: Due to financial cut backs I had to discontinue my internet service so I have been using Philzs free WiFi. Sometimes I'm able to get a chia sometimes I couldn't. This location is a block away from my apt and very convenient. So one day I'm Working on my laptop job searching doing résumé stuff listening to my music when The manager walks right up to me and gets in my face about how I need to buy something. Never mind the crazy homeless that come in and use the bathroom. This location has signs about the bathroom use but NOTHING about free WiFi is just for customers inside the store. It's not even posted on their FB page when you login. Also let me point out that that the network can be easily accessed outside the building. You don't even have to be inside the building. I emailed their corporate office about the incident. It was very upsetting and I almost started to cry but held back my tears. She was so mean about it. I told her to hold on that I'm in the middle of something that I need to complete but she was insistent that I but something NOW. OK fine I told her just give me a second. I dug through my backpack and found a couple of dollars. Not much but I bought an odawalla. I have since been working so I'm able to buy a chia to use their internet if I have to. The one star is for the Mean Manager the location is great. You are there to sell coffee not monitor whose using the internet focus on that. There are people in SF that are working hard to better their situation so throw us a bone so we can get back on our feet.
author: Veronica P.

description: I must applaud the owner. Shortly after my previously not so glowing review, not only the owner himself but someone else in charge of PR emailed me, apologized for my bad experience, asked questions about the person with the attitude, and promptly sent me a gift card to return for a better experience. I did, and am now a loyal customer. A business can't help if they have a rouge employee, but they have to care about their customers to try to improve. A Philz gets 5 stars for making an effort. Thank you!
author: Jasmine C.

description: They're nice, but I'm just come to the conclusion I'm not a fan of Philz' coffee
author: Adriana B.

description: thank god the new location opened.
author: Audrey K.

description: Terrible service. Rude employees. I tripped and fell and no one helped me, staff just looked at me blankly. And to add insult to injury they got my order wrong and gave me an attitude. Van ness philz is MUCH better
author: Thaibinh T.

description: The coffee is great but I have gotten coffee with a lot of coffee grinds twice and I have had problems with getting the cream and sugar wrong great product human error seems to high I dont think I'm going back.  I think its the look I get when I mention I said light medium  not medium medium, like thats what you orderd.
author: Ken C.

description: Fun, friendly staff that will answer all your questions. Great music and comfy chairs. Large clean store and tasty drinks. Busier on the weekdays because it's near the Federal building and the law school but dang, these guys bust out an impressive amount of drinks! Lots of outlets - great for working.
author: Jen M.

description: Although, I am not too crazy about their location, but it's hard to deny that their coffee is great and customer service is great. I am having my first New Manhattan. It has that earthy aroma, which i really like. This is gonna help me with my studying for the rest of the day...
author: Den-Mark M.

description: Worth the wait! Mocha Tesora is best "not very sweet", wouldn't recommend changing from cream to milk. Favorite coffee thus far is Turkish w/ fresh mint and vanilla soy:) yum! Their fruit muffin is very good and for a healthier option the big oat bar isn't bad! Love this place.
author: B V.

description: I actually didn't know coffee could be that tasty. Fantastic service - very friendly and patient staff explained how the menu worked, and gave recommendations based on preferences. Wouldn't have minded a few more couches. I will definitely go back to try a different coffee (I had the Scrumptious Turkish one, or whatever it was called...)
author: Jasmine H.

description: I work across the street and I love philz coffee but this place is a hot mess.  Much slower than any other philz normally.  Today there was no line, but my coffee took 20 mins.  Coffee maker was chatting people up, forgot about me, and then when I looked over after a long wait, he started my coffee and explained that he was sleepy.  Um, yeah.  And then they forgot my bagel.  I took the refund rather than wait longer and be later for work.  Coffee's good, and people were nice but not trying hard -- they seemed beleaguered.  I would (will) avoid, maybe try again in a few months.
author: jamie e.
